00614 #if 0
00615 /* Returns a MD_Symbol structure with the desired name, or NULL
00616  * if the name is not in the symbol table.
00617  */
00618 static MD_Symbol *
00619 MD_find_symbol (MD_Symbol_Table * table, char *name)
00620 {
00621   MD_Symbol *symbol;
00622   unsigned int hash_val, hash_index;
00623 
00624   /* Get the hash value for the name */
00625   hash_val = MD_hash_string (name);
00626 
00627   /* Get the index into the hash table */
00628   hash_index = hash_val & table->hash_mask;
00629 
00630   /* Search the linked list for matching name */
00631   for (symbol = table->hash[hash_index]; symbol != NULL;
00632        symbol = symbol->next_hash)
00633     {
00634       /* Compare hash_vals first before using string compare */
00635       if ((symbol->hash_val == hash_val)
00636           && (strcmp (symbol->name, name) == 0))
00637         {
00638           return (symbol);
00639         }
00640     }
00641   return (NULL);
00642 }
00643 #endif
00644 /* 
00645  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  FOR USE ONLY BY MD MACROS AND ROUTINES!
00646  * Returns the data for desired name, or NULL
00647  * if the name is not in the symbol table.
00648  */
00649 void *
00650 _MD_find_symbol_data (MD_Symbol_Table * table, char *name)
00651 {
00652   MD_Symbol *symbol;
00653   unsigned int hash_val, hash_index;
00654 
00655   /* Get the hash value for the name */
00656   hash_val = MD_hash_string (name);
00657 
00658   /* Get the index into the hash table */
00659   hash_index = hash_val & table->hash_mask;
00660 
00661   /* Search the linked list for matching name */
00662   for (symbol = table->hash[hash_index]; symbol != NULL;
00663        symbol = symbol->next_hash)
00664     {
00665       /* Compare hash_vals first before using string compare */
00666       if ((symbol->hash_val == hash_val)
00667           && (strcmp (symbol->name, name) == 0))
00668         {
00669           return (symbol->data);
00670         }
00671     }
00672   return (NULL);
00673 }
00674 
00675 /* Deletes symbol and optionally deletes the data using the free routine */
00676 void
00677 MD_delete_symbol (MD_Symbol * symbol, void (*free_routine) (void *))
00678 {
00679   MD_Symbol_Table *table;
00680   MD_Symbol *next_hash, *prev_hash, *next_symbol, *prev_symbol;
00681   unsigned int hash_index;
00682 
00683   /* Get the table the symbol is from */
00684   table = symbol->table;
00685 
00686   /* Get the hash index from the symbol's hash_val */
00687   hash_index = symbol->hash_val & table->hash_mask;
00688 
00689   /* Remove symbol from hash table */
00690   prev_hash = symbol->prev_hash;
00691   next_hash = symbol->next_hash;
00692   if (prev_hash == NULL)
00693     table->hash[hash_index] = next_hash;
00694   else
00695     prev_hash->next_hash = next_hash;
00696 
00697   if (next_hash != NULL)
00698     next_hash->prev_hash = prev_hash;
00699 
00700   /* Remove symbol from symbol list */
00701   prev_symbol = symbol->prev_symbol;
00702   next_symbol = symbol->next_symbol;
00703   if (prev_symbol == NULL)
00704     table->head_symbol = next_symbol;
00705   else
00706     prev_symbol->next_symbol = next_symbol;
00707 
00708   if (next_symbol == NULL)
00709     table->tail_symbol = prev_symbol;
00710   else
00711     next_symbol->prev_symbol = prev_symbol;
00712 
00713 
00714   /* If free routine specified, free symbol data */
00715   if (free_routine != NULL)
00716     free_routine (symbol->data);
00717 
00718   /* Free symbol structure */
00719   L_free (MD_Symbol_pool, symbol);
00720 
00721   /* Decrement table symbol count */
00722   table->symbol_count--;
00723 }
00724 
00725 
00726 
00727 #if 0
00728 /* Prints out the symbol table's hash table (debug routine) */
00729 static void
00730 MD_print_symbol_table_hash (FILE * out, MD_Symbol_Table * table)
00731 {
00732   int hash_index, lines;
00733 #if 0
00734   MD_Symbol *symbol;
00735 #endif
00736 
00737   /* Count lines used in table */
00738   lines = 0;
00739   for (hash_index = 0; hash_index < table->hash_size; hash_index++)
00740     {
00741       if (table->hash[hash_index] != NULL)
00742         lines++;
00743     }
00744   fprintf (out, "%s has %i entries (hash size %i, used %i):\n",
00745            table->name, table->symbol_count, table->hash_size, lines);
00746 
00747 #if 0
00748   /* For each hash_index in hash table */
00749   for (hash_index = 0; hash_index < table->hash_size; hash_index++)
00750     {
00751       /* Skip empty lines */
00752       if (table->hash[hash_index] == NULL)
00753         continue;
00754 
00755       fprintf (out, "%4i:", hash_index);
00756       for (symbol = table->hash[hash_index]; symbol != NULL;
00757            symbol = symbol->next_hash)
00758         {
00759           fprintf (out, " %s(%i)", symbol->name, symbol->hash_val);
00760         }
00761       fprintf (out, "\n");
00762     }
00763 #endif
00764 }
00765 #endif
00766 
00767 /* Creates a new MD with an initial size suitable for the specified
00768  * number of sections.  The MD automatically resizes (upward) when
00769  * appropriate, so 0 sections may be specified.
00770  */
00771 MD *
00772 MD_new_md (char *name, int num_sections)
00773 {
00774   MD *md;
00775 
00776   /* If the expected number of sections is negative, force to be 0 */
00777   if (num_sections < 0)
00778     num_sections = 0;
00779 
00780   /* To catch improperly specified num_sections, ensure that the
00781    * expected size is less than a billion.  (Also prevents symbol
00782    * table routines from punting.)
00783    */
00784   if (num_sections > 1000000000)
00785     MD_punt (NULL, "MD_new_md: unreasonable num_sections (%u)", num_sections);
00786 
00787   /* Initialize all the pools used by the MD routines on first call
00788    * to MD_new_md().
00789    */
00790   if (MD_pool == NULL)
00791     {
00792       MD_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("MD", sizeof (MD), 1);
00793       MD_Symbol_Table_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("MD_Symbol_Table",
00794                                                   sizeof (MD_Symbol_Table),
00795                                                   16);
00796       MD_Symbol_pool =
00797         L_create_alloc_pool ("MD_Symbol", sizeof (MD_Symbol), 64);
00798       MD_Section_pool =
00799         L_create_alloc_pool ("MD_Section", sizeof (MD_Section), 16);
00800       MD_Field_Decl_pool =
00801         L_create_alloc_pool ("MD_Field_Decl", sizeof (MD_Field_Decl), 16);
00802       MD_Element_Req_pool =
00803         L_create_alloc_pool ("MD_Element_Req", sizeof (MD_Element_Req), 64);
00804       MD_Entry_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("MD_Entry", sizeof (MD_Entry), 64);
00805       MD_Field_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("MD_Field", sizeof (MD_Field), 64);
00806       MD_Element_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("MD_Element",
00807                                              sizeof (MD_Element), 64);
00808     }
00809 
00810   /* Allocate new md */
00811   md = (MD *) L_alloc (MD_pool);
00812 
00813   /* Initialize fields */
00814   md->name = MD_strdup (name);
00815   md->section_table = MD_new_symbol_table (md, "Section table", num_sections);
00816 
00817   /* Return new md */
00818   return (md);
00819 }
00820 
00821 /* Frees up all memory associated with the md.
00822  * If no other mds are allocated, free up the memory used by
00823  * the L_alloc memory manager.
00824  */
00825 void
00826 MD_delete_md (MD * md)
00827 {
00828   char *name;
00829 
00830   /* Free name last (for error messages) */
00831   name = md->name;
00832 
00833   /* Free section symbol table and all the information contained in it. */
00834   MD_delete_symbol_table (md->section_table,
00835                           (void (*)(void *)) _MD_free_section);
00836 
00837   /* Free the md structure */
00838   L_free (MD_pool, md);
00839 
00840   /* If no other mds are allocated, attempt to free the memory
00841    * used by the L_alloc memory manager.
00842    */
00843   if (MD_pool->allocated == MD_pool->free)
00844     {
00845       /* The following free routines will give warnings if some
00846        * of the allocated memory is still in use.
00847        * We will through away the memory unfreed if this
00848        * occurs (it shouldn't!)
00849        */
00850       L_free_alloc_pool (MD_pool);
00851       L_free_alloc_pool (MD_Symbol_Table_pool);
00852       L_free_alloc_pool (MD_Symbol_pool);
00853       L_free_alloc_pool (MD_Section_pool);
00854       L_free_alloc_pool (MD_Entry_pool);
00855       L_free_alloc_pool (MD_Field_Decl_pool);
00856       L_free_alloc_pool (MD_Element_Req_pool);
00857       L_free_alloc_pool (MD_Field_pool);
00858       L_free_alloc_pool (MD_Element_pool);
00859 
00860       /* Set all pool pointer's to NULL to prevent use of freed memory
00861        * (and to signal that pools need to be initialized if used)
00862        */
00863       MD_pool = NULL;
00864       MD_Symbol_Table_pool = NULL;
00865       MD_Symbol_pool = NULL;
00866       MD_Section_pool = NULL;
00867       MD_Entry_pool = NULL;
00868       MD_Field_Decl_pool = NULL;
00869       MD_Element_Req_pool = NULL;
00870       MD_Field_pool = NULL;
00871       MD_Element_pool = NULL;
00872     }
00873 
00874   /* Free the md's name */
00875   free (name);
00876 }
00877 
00878 /*
00879  * This function checks the elements in the specified md.
00880  * 
00881  * Returns the number of required fields not specified + the 
00882  * number of elements with incorrect type in the entire md (0 if all ok).
00883  * 
00884  * If out is non-NULL, warning messages for non-specified required field
00885  * and for each element with incorrect type will be printed to out.
00886  */
00887 int
00888 MD_check_md (FILE * out, MD * md)
00889 {
00890   MD_Symbol *symbol;
00891   MD_Section *section;
00892   int error_count;
00893 
00894   /* Initialize error count */
00895   error_count = 0;
00896 
00897   /* Scan every section in the md for errors */
00898   for (symbol = md->section_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
00899        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
00900     {
00901       /* Get the section pointed to by this symbol */
00902       section = (MD_Section *) symbol->data;
00903 
00904       /* Sum up all the errors found by check section */
00905       error_count += _MD_check_section (out, section, "MD_check_md");
00906     }
00907 
00908   /* Return the number of errors found in the md */
00909   return (error_count);
00910 }
00911 
00912 
00913 /* Creates a md buf for the MD_read routines */
00914 MD_Buf *
00915 MD_new_buf ()
00916 {
00917   MD_Buf *buf;
00918   int buf_size;
00919 
00920   /* Allocate new buf */
00921   buf = (MD_Buf *) L_alloc (MD_Buf_pool);
00922 
00923   /* Create a initial buffer of size 128 */
00924   buf_size = 128;
00925   buf->buf = (char *) malloc (buf_size);
00926   if (buf->buf == NULL)
00927     MD_punt (NULL, "MD_new_buf: out of memory (size %i)", buf_size);
00928   buf->buf_size = buf_size;
00929 
00930   /* Return the new buffer */
00931   return (buf);
00932 }
00933 
00934 /* Doubles the size of the buffer in buf */
00935 void
00936 MD_resize_buf (MD_Buf * buf)
00937 {
00938   char *old_buf, *new_buf;
00939   int old_size, new_size, i;
00940 
00941   /* Get fields into local variables for ease of use */
00942   old_buf = buf->buf;
00943   old_size = buf->buf_size;
00944 
00945   /* Double buffer size */
00946   new_size = old_size << 1;
00947 
00948   new_buf = (char *) malloc (new_size);
00949   if (new_buf == NULL)
00950     MD_punt (NULL, "MD_resize_buf: out of memory (size %i)", new_size);
00951 
00952   /* Copy over contents of old buffer */
00953   for (i = 0; i < old_size; i++)
00954     new_buf[i] = old_buf[i];
00955 
00956   /* Free old buf and reset structure variables */
00957   free (old_buf);
00958   buf->buf = new_buf;
00959   buf->buf_size = new_size;
00960 }
00961 
00962 /* Frees md buf used by MD_read routines */
00963 void
00964 MD_delete_buf (MD_Buf * buf)
00965 {
00966   /* Free buffer */
00967   free (buf->buf);
00968 
00969   /* Free buffer structure */
00970   L_free (MD_Buf_pool, buf);
00971 }
00972 
00973 void
00974 MD_read_consume_comments (FILE * in)
00975 {
00976   int ch;
00977   for ( ; ; ) {
00978     /* Try reading a line, and if it's a comment, discard the whole line. */
00979 
00980     if ((ch = getc (in)) != '/') {
00981       /* if first character is not a slash, exit */
00982       ungetc(ch, in);
00983       return;
00984     } else if ((ch = getc (in)) != '/') {
00985       /* if second character is not a slash, exit */
00986       ungetc(ch, in);
00987       return;
00988     } else {
00989       /* both leading characters were '/', consume characters until newline */
00990       while ((ch = getc (in)) != '\n') {
00991         /* if we get an EOF along the way, we don't handle it, push it back */
00992         if (ch == EOF) {
00993           ungetc(ch, in);
00994           return;
00995         }
00996       }
00997     }
00998   }
00999 }
01000 
01001 /* Reads an hex integer and returns the value. 
01002  * Uses fast conversion algorithm that assumes ascii and that all the
01003  * integers written in MD_write_md are in lower-case hex.
01004  */
01005 int
01006 MD_read_int (FILE * in)
01007 {
01008   int value, ch, negate;
01009   unsigned int nibble;
01010 
01011   /* Skip leading whitespace */
01012   while ((ch = getc (in)) != EOF)
01013     {
01014       if (ch != ' ')
01015         break;
01016     }
01017 
01018   /* Punt if hit EOF */
01019   if (ch == EOF)
01020     MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_int: unexpected EOF");
01021 
01022   /* Is value negative? */
01023   negate = 0;
01024   if (ch == '-')
01025     {
01026       negate = 1;
01027       if ((ch = getc (in)) == EOF)
01028         MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_int: unexpected EOF");
01029     }
01030 
01031   /* Get the first nibble, assume ascii and using 'a' thru 'f' */
01032   if (ch >= 'a')
01033     nibble = 10 + ch - 'a';
01034   else
01035     nibble = ch - '0';
01036 
01037   /* Make sure in range */
01038   if (nibble > 15)
01039     MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_int: int expected not '%c'", ch);
01040 
01041   /* Initially set value to this */
01042   value = nibble;
01043 
01044   /* Read in rest of int */
01045   while ((ch = getc (in)) != EOF)
01046     {
01047       /* Stop at space or newline */
01048       if ((ch == ' ') || (ch == '\n'))
01049         break;
01050 
01051       /* Get the next nibble, assume ascii and using 'a' thru 'f' */
01052       if (ch >= 'a')
01053         nibble = 10 + ch - 'a';
01054       else
01055         nibble = ch - '0';
01056 
01057       /* Make sure in range */
01058       if (nibble > 15)
01059         MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_int: int expected not '%c'", ch);
01060 
01061       /* Shift value and add in nibble */
01062       value = (value << 4) + nibble;
01063     }
01064 
01065   /* If not at EOF, put back character just read */
01066   if (ch != EOF)
01067     ungetc (ch, in);
01068 
01069   /* Negate value if necessary */
01070   if (negate)
01071     value = -value;
01072 
01073   /* Return value read in */
01074   return (value);
01075 }
01076 
01077 /* Reads an double into buf and returns its value (contents of buf destroyed)
01078  */
01079 double
01080 MD_read_double (FILE * in, MD_Buf * value_buf)
01081 {
01082   char *buf, *end_ptr;
01083   int i, ch, resize_size;
01084   double value;
01085 
01086   /* Get values in value_buf into local variables for ease of access */
01087   buf = value_buf->buf;
01088   resize_size = value_buf->buf_size - 2;        /* Want space for terminator */
01089 
01090   /* Skip leading whitespace */
01091   while ((ch = getc (in)) != EOF)
01092     {
01093       if (ch != ' ')
01094         break;
01095     }
01096 
01097   /* Punt if hit EOF */
01098   if (ch == EOF)
01099     MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_double: unexpected EOF");
01100 
01101   /* Place first character of in buffer */
01102   buf[0] = ch;
01103   i = 1;
01104 
01105   /* Read in rest of double */
01106   while ((ch = getc (in)) != EOF)
01107     {
01108       /* Stop at space or newline */
01109       if ((ch == ' ') || (ch == '\n'))
01110         break;
01111 
01112       /* Resize buffer if necessary */
01113       if (i >= resize_size)
01114         {
01115           MD_resize_buf (value_buf);
01116 
01117           /* Get new values into local variables */
01118           buf = value_buf->buf;
01119           resize_size = value_buf->buf_size - 2;
01120         }
01121 
01122       buf[i] = ch;
01123       i++;
01124     }
01125 
01126   /* If not at EOF, put back character just read */
01127   if (ch != EOF)
01128     ungetc (ch, in);
01129 
01130   /* Terminate buffer */
01131   buf[i] = 0;
01132 
01133   /* Get the double value */
01134   value = strtod (buf, &end_ptr);
01135 
01136   /* Make sure read in something */
01137   if (*end_ptr != 0)
01138     MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_double: double expected not '%s'!", buf);
01139 
01140   /* Return value read in */
01141   return (value);
01142 }
01143 
01144 /* Reads an string into buf (value returned in buf) */
01145 void
01146 MD_read_string (FILE * in, MD_Buf * value_buf)
01147 {
01148   char *buf;
01149   int i, ch, resize_size;
01150 
01151   /* Get values in value_buf into local variables for ease of access */
01152   buf = value_buf->buf;
01153   resize_size = value_buf->buf_size - 2;        /* Want space for terminator */
01154 
01155   /* Dont skip leading whitespace */
01156 
01157   i = 0;
01158 
01159   /* Read in string */
01160   while ((ch = getc (in)) != EOF)
01161     {
01162       /* Stop at newline only (spaces can be part of the string) */
01163       if (ch == '\n')
01164         break;
01165 
01166       /* Resize buffer if necessary */
01167       if (i >= resize_size)
01168         {
01169           MD_resize_buf (value_buf);
01170 
01171           /* Get new values into local variables */
01172           buf = value_buf->buf;
01173           resize_size = value_buf->buf_size - 2;
01174         }
01175 
01176       buf[i] = ch;
01177       i++;
01178     }
01179 
01180   /* If not at EOF, put back character just read */
01181   if (ch != EOF)
01182     ungetc (ch, in);
01183   /* Make sure not at EOF with empty buffer */
01184   else if (i == 0)
01185     MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_string: unexpected EOF");
01186 
01187   /* Terminate buffer, value returned in value_buffer (buf) */
01188   buf[i] = 0;
01189 }
01190 
01191 /* Reads an binary block of size block_size into buf (value returned in buf) */
01192 void
01193 MD_read_block (FILE * in, unsigned int block_size, MD_Buf * value_buf)
01194 {
01195   unsigned char *buf;
01196   int i, ch;
01197 
01198   /* Resize buffer until big enough for binary block */
01199   while (block_size > value_buf->buf_size)
01200     MD_resize_buf (value_buf);
01201 
01202   /* Get values in value_buf into local variables for ease of access */
01203   buf = (unsigned char *) value_buf->buf;
01204 
01205   /* Read in binary block into buffer, use getc to guarentee compatibility
01206    * with ungetc (although fread seems to work with ungetc on HPUX).
01207    */
01208   for (i = 0; i < block_size; i++)
01209     {
01210       /* Get next character, punt if EOF */
01211       if ((ch = getc (in)) == EOF)
01212         MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_block: unexpected EOF");
01213 
01214       /* Write character into binary block buffer */
01215       buf[i] = (unsigned char) ch;
01216     }
01217 }
01218 
01219 void
01220 MD_read_nl (FILE * in)
01221 {
01222   int ch;
01223 
01224   ch = getc (in);
01225   if (ch != '\n')
01226     {
01227       if (ch == EOF)
01228         MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_nl: unexpected EOF");
01229 
01230       MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_nl: newline expected not '%c'!", ch);
01231     }
01232 }
01233 
01234 void
01235 MD_read_sp (FILE * in)
01236 {
01237   int ch;
01238 
01239   ch = getc (in);
01240   if (ch != ' ')
01241     {
01242       if (ch == EOF)
01243         MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_sp: unexpected EOF");
01244 
01245       MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_sp: space expected not '%c'!", ch);
01246     }
01247 }
01248 
01249 /* Creates a md from the low-level format file created by MD_write_md */
01250 MD *
01251 MD_read_md (FILE * in, char *name)
01252 {
01253   MD *md;
01254   MD_Section *section, **section_array, **target_array;
01255   MD_Entry *entry, **entry_array, *link;
01256   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl, **field_decl_array;
01257   MD_Buf *name_buf, *value_buf;
01258   MD_Field *field;
01259   int section_array_size, entry_array_size;
01260   int section_index, entry_index, field_decl_index;
01261   int entry_count, field_decl_count;
01262   char type_marker, kleene_marker, require_marker;
01263   MD_FIELD_TYPE field_type = 0;
01264   int kleene_starred = 0, require_count, require_index, target_index;
01265   int target_count, local_entry_index, element_index, element_count;
01266   int field_count, field_index, int_value, link_index;
01267   double double_value;
01268   unsigned int block_size;
01269   int i;
01270 
01271   /* Create buf alloc pool used by read routines */
01272   MD_Buf_pool = L_create_alloc_pool ("MD_Buf", sizeof (MD_Buf), 4);
01273 
01274   /* Create the buffers we will need to read in the md */
01275   name_buf = MD_new_buf ();
01276   value_buf = MD_new_buf ();
01277 
01278   /* Comment added to the beginning of LMDES files to prevent new   *
01279    * Trimaran users from being confused and editing LMDES files.    *
01280    *                                <lieberm 06/24/2006>            */
01281   MD_read_consume_comments (in);
01282 
01283   /* Get the number of sections and entries */
01284   section_array_size = MD_read_int (in);
01285   entry_array_size = MD_read_int (in);
01286   MD_read_nl (in);
01287   MD_read_nl (in);
01288 
01289   /* Create md */
01290   md = MD_new_md (name, section_array_size);
01291 
01292 /*    printf ("section_array_size = %i   entry_array_size = %i\n",
01293             section_array_size, entry_array_size); */
01294 
01295   /* Allocate section and entry arrays */
01296   section_array = (MD_Section **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Section *) *
01297                                           section_array_size);
01298   if (section_array == NULL)
01299     {
01300       MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_md: out of memory (size %i).",
01301                section_array_size);
01302     }
01303 
01304   entry_array = (MD_Entry **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Entry *) * entry_array_size);
01305   if (entry_array == NULL)
01306     {
01307       MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_md: out of memory (size %i).",
01308                entry_array_size);
01309     }
01310 
01311   /* Initialize entry index */
01312   entry_index = 0;
01313 
01314   /* Read in each section and the section's entry names */
01315   for (section_index = 0; section_index < section_array_size; section_index++)
01316     {
01317       /* Read in section name, entry count and field decl count */
01318       MD_read_string (in, name_buf);
01319       MD_read_nl (in);
01320 
01321       entry_count = MD_read_int (in);
01322       field_decl_count = MD_read_int (in);
01323       MD_read_nl (in);
01324 
01325 /*      printf ("Read %s %i %i\n", name_buf->buf, entry_count, 
01326                 field_decl_count);*/
01327 
01328       /* Create section and put in section array */
01329       section = MD_new_section (md, name_buf->buf, entry_count,
01330                                 field_decl_count);
01331       section_array[section_index] = section;
01332 
01333       /* Read in section's entry names */
01334       for (i = 0; i < entry_count; i++)
01335         {
01336           MD_read_string (in, name_buf);
01337           MD_read_nl (in);
01338 
01339           /* Create entry and put in entry array */
01340           entry = MD_new_entry (section, name_buf->buf);
01341           entry_array[entry_index++] = entry;
01342         }
01343       MD_read_nl (in);
01344     }
01345   MD_read_nl (in);
01346 
01347   /* Restart entry index for reading in all the entry's fields */
01348   entry_index = 0;
01349 
01350   /* Read in each section's field declarations and the
01351    * field values for all entries in the section.
01352    */
01353   for (section_index = 0; section_index < section_array_size; section_index++)
01354     {
01355       /* Read in section name, entry count and field decl count */
01356       MD_read_string (in, name_buf);
01357 /*      printf ("Reading section %s\n", name_buf->buf); */
01358       MD_read_nl (in);
01359 
01360       entry_count = MD_read_int (in);
01361       field_decl_count = MD_read_int (in);
01362       MD_read_nl (in);
01363 
01364       /* Get the section we expect to be in */
01365       section = section_array[section_index];
01366 
01367       /* Make sure the name matches the name read in */
01368       if (strcmp (name_buf->buf, section->name) != 0)
01369         {
01370           MD_punt (NULL, "Section '%s' expected, not '%s'!",
01371                    section->name, name_buf->buf);
01372         }
01373 
01374       /* Create array only if there are field declarations */
01375       if (field_decl_count > 0)
01376         {
01377           /* Create field declaration array */
01378           field_decl_array =
01379             (MD_Field_Decl **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Field_Decl *) *
01380                                        field_decl_count);
01381           if (field_decl_array == NULL)
01382             MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_md: Out of memory (size %i)",
01383                      field_decl_count);
01384         }
01385       else
01386         {
01387           /* Should not be used if there are no field declarations */
01388           field_decl_array = NULL;
01389         }
01390 
01391       /* Read in the field declarations */
01392       for (field_decl_index = 0; field_decl_index < field_decl_count;
01393            field_decl_index++)
01394         {
01395           /* Get field name */
01396           MD_read_string (in, name_buf);
01397 /*          printf ("Declaring field '%s'\n", name_buf->buf); */
01398           MD_read_nl (in);
01399 
01400           /* Get type of field declaration */
01401           type_marker = getc (in);
01402 
01403           switch (type_marker)
01404             {
01405             case 'R':
01406               field_type = MD_REQUIRED_FIELD;
01407               break;
01408 
01409             case 'O':
01410               field_type = MD_OPTIONAL_FIELD;
01411               break;
01412 
01413             default:
01414               MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_md: Unknown field decl type '%c'",
01415                        type_marker);
01416             }
01417 
01418           require_count = MD_read_int (in);
01419           MD_read_sp (in);
01420           kleene_marker = getc (in);
01421 
01422           switch (kleene_marker)
01423             {
01424             case '*':
01425               kleene_starred = 1;
01426               break;
01427 
01428             case '-':
01429               kleene_starred = 0;
01430               break;
01431 
01432             default:
01433               MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_md: Unknown kleene marker '%c'",
01434                        kleene_marker);
01435             }
01436           MD_read_nl (in);
01437 
01438           /* Create field declaration and place into array */
01439           field_decl = MD_new_field_decl (section, name_buf->buf, field_type);
01440           field_decl_array[field_decl_index] = field_decl;
01441 
01442 /*          printf ("Read field_decl %s\n", name_buf->buf); */
01443 
01444           /* Read in requirements */
01445           for (require_index = 0; require_index < require_count;
01446                require_index++)
01447             {
01448               /* Get requirement type */
01449               require_marker = getc (in);
01450 
01451               /* Define requirment */
01452               switch (require_marker)
01453                 {
01454                 case 'I':
01455                   MD_require_int (field_decl, require_index);
01456                   break;
01457 
01458                 case 'D':
01459                   MD_require_double (field_decl, require_index);
01460                   break;
01461 
01462                 case 'S':
01463                   MD_require_string (field_decl, require_index);
01464                   break;
01465 
01466                 case 'B':
01467                   MD_require_block (field_decl, require_index);
01468                   break;
01469 
01470                 case 'L':
01471                   /* Get the number of targets */
01472                   target_count = MD_read_int (in);
01473 
01474                   /* Create target array */
01475                   target_array =
01476                     (MD_Section **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Section *) *
01477                                             target_count);
01478 
01479                   if (target_array == NULL)
01480                     {
01481                       MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_md: Out of memory (size %i)",
01482                                target_count);
01483                     }
01484 
01485                   /* Read in targets */
01486                   for (i = 0; i < target_count; i++)
01487                     {
01488                       target_index = MD_read_int (in);
01489                       target_array[i] = section_array[target_index];
01490                     }
01491 
01492                   MD_require_multi_target_link (field_decl, require_index,
01493                                                 target_count, target_array);
01494 
01495                   /* Free target array */
01496                   free (target_array);
01497 
01498                   break;
01499 
01500                 default:
01501                   MD_punt (NULL,
01502                            "MD_read_md: Unknown requirement type '%c'",
01503                            require_marker);
01504 
01505                 }
01506               MD_read_nl (in);
01507 
01508             }
01509           MD_read_nl (in);
01510 
01511           /* Mark last requirement as kleene starred (if required) */
01512           if (kleene_starred)
01513             {
01514               MD_kleene_star_requirement (field_decl, require_count - 1);
01515             }
01516         }
01517       /* Read in the fields for each entry */
01518       for (local_entry_index = 0; local_entry_index < entry_count;
01519            local_entry_index++)
01520         {
01521           /* Get the entry we are processing, use entry_index
01522            * to get entry id from start of md (not from start
01523            * of section)
01524            */
01525           entry = entry_array[entry_index++];
01526 
01527           /* Read the number of fields defined */
01528           field_count = MD_read_int (in);
01529           MD_read_nl (in);
01530           MD_read_nl (in);
01531 
01532           /* Read in the fields defined */
01533           for (i = 0; i < field_count; i++)
01534             {
01535               /* Get the field index and field decl for this index */
01536               field_index = MD_read_int (in);
01537               element_count = MD_read_int (in);
01538               MD_read_nl (in);
01539 
01540               field_decl = field_decl_array[field_index];
01541 
01542 /*              printf ("Reading field %s\n", field_decl->name); */
01543 
01544               /* Create field */
01545               field = MD_new_field (entry, field_decl, element_count);
01546 
01547               /* Read in the elements */
01548               for (element_index = 0; element_index < element_count;
01549                    element_index++)
01550                 {
01551                   /* Get the type of element */
01552                   type_marker = getc (in);
01553 
01554                   /* Read in depending on type */
01555                   switch (type_marker)
01556                     {
01557                     case 'I':
01558                       int_value = MD_read_int (in);
01559                       MD_set_int (field, element_index, int_value);
01560                       break;
01561 
01562                     case 'D':
01563                       double_value = MD_read_double (in, value_buf);
01564                       MD_set_double (field, element_index, double_value);
01565                       break;
01566 
01567                     case 'S':
01568                       MD_read_string (in, value_buf);
01569                       MD_set_string (field, element_index, value_buf->buf);
01570                       break;
01571 
01572                     case 'B':
01573                       block_size = MD_read_int (in);
01574                       MD_read_sp (in);
01575                       MD_read_block (in, block_size, value_buf);
01576                       MD_set_block (field, element_index, block_size,
01577                                     (void *) value_buf->buf);
01578                       break;
01579 
01580                     case 'L':
01581                       link_index = MD_read_int (in);
01582                       link = entry_array[link_index];
01583                       MD_set_link (field, element_index, link);
01584                       break;
01585 
01586                     default:
01587                       MD_punt (NULL, "MD_read_md: Uknown element type '%c'.",
01588                                type_marker);
01589                     }
01590                   MD_read_nl (in);
01591                 }
01592               MD_read_nl (in);
01593             }
01594         }
01595       MD_read_nl (in);
01596 
01597       /* Free field_decl_array */
01598       if (field_decl_array != NULL)
01599         free (field_decl_array);
01600     }
01601 
01602   /* Free arrays we created for reading in md */
01603   free (section_array);
01604   free (entry_array);
01605 
01606 
01607   /* Free the buffers we created */
01608   MD_delete_buf (name_buf);
01609   MD_delete_buf (value_buf);
01610 
01611   /* Free the buf alloc pool */
01612   L_free_alloc_pool (MD_Buf_pool);
01613 
01614   /* Return the md created */
01615   return (md);
01616 }
01617 
01618 
01619 
01620 /* Writes the md's contents to the file in the low-level format
01621  * that MD_read_md() expects.
01622  */
01623 void
01624 MD_write_md (FILE * out, MD * md)
01625 {
01626   MD_Symbol *section_symbol, *entry_symbol, *field_decl_symbol;
01627   MD_Section *section, **link_array;
01628   MD_Entry *entry;
01629   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
01630   MD_Element_Req *element_req, **require_array;
01631   MD_Field **field_array, *field;
01632   MD_Element *element, **element_array;
01633   int total_entry_count, max_require_index, i;
01634   unsigned int block_size;
01635   int section_id, entry_id, field_decl_id, link_array_size;
01636   int max_field_index, field_count, max_assigned_index, require_index;
01637   char type_marker = '\0', kleene_marker;
01638 
01639   /* Initialize the total number of entries in the md */
01640   total_entry_count = 0;
01641 
01642   /* Initialize the seciton and entry id counters.  */
01643   section_id = 0;
01644   entry_id = 0;
01645 
01646   /* Scan entire md, assigning ids to all the symbols */
01647   for (section_symbol = md->section_table->head_symbol;
01648        section_symbol != NULL; section_symbol = section_symbol->next_symbol)
01649     {
01650       /* Set the section symbol id */
01651       section_symbol->symbol_id = section_id++;
01652 
01653       /* Get the section for ease of use */
01654       section = (MD_Section *) section_symbol->data;
01655 
01656       /* Set the field_ids for all fields declared for this section.
01657        * Starts from 0 at the beginning of each section.
01658        */
01659       field_decl_id = 0;
01660       for (field_decl_symbol = section->field_decl_table->head_symbol;
01661            field_decl_symbol != NULL;
01662            field_decl_symbol = field_decl_symbol->next_symbol)
01663         {
01664           field_decl_symbol->symbol_id = field_decl_id++;
01665         }
01666 
01667 
01668       /* Set the symbol_ids for all entries in this table.
01669        * Starts from 0 at beginning of md to give each entry
01670        * a unique id.
01671        */
01672       for (entry_symbol = section->entry_table->head_symbol;
01673            entry_symbol != NULL; entry_symbol = entry_symbol->next_symbol)
01674         {
01675           entry_symbol->symbol_id = entry_id++;
01676         }
01677 
01678       /* Update the total entry count */
01679       total_entry_count += section->entry_table->symbol_count;
01680     }
01681 
01682   /* Comment added to the beginning of LMDES files to prevent new   *
01683    * Trimaran users from being confused and editing LMDES files.    *
01684    *                                <lieberm 06/24/2006>            */
01685   fprintf (out, "// %s\n// %s\n// %s\n",
01686       "*** DO NOT EDIT MANUALLY! ***", 
01687       "This is an automatically-generated LMDES file, created from an HMDES",
01688       "file. Edit the HMDES file that was compiled to create this file.");
01689 
01690   /* Write out how many sections and entries in the md */
01691   fprintf (out, "%x %x\n\n", md->section_table->symbol_count,
01692            total_entry_count);
01693 
01694   /* Write out the header for each section and list out the
01695    * entries in each section.
01696    */
01697   for (section_symbol = md->section_table->head_symbol;
01698        section_symbol != NULL; section_symbol = section_symbol->next_symbol)
01699     {
01700       /* Get the section for ease of use */
01701       section = (MD_Section *) section_symbol->data;
01702 
01703       /* Write out each section name and how many entries the section
01704        * has and how many fields are declared for the section.
01705        */
01706 #if 0
01707       fprintf (out, "%i %s %i %i\n", section_symbol->symbol_id,
01708                section->name,
01709                section->entry_table->symbol_count,
01710                section->field_decl_table->symbol_count);
01711 #endif
01712       fprintf (out, "%s\n%x %x\n",
01713                section->name,
01714                section->entry_table->symbol_count,
01715                section->field_decl_table->symbol_count);
01716 
01717       for (entry_symbol = section->entry_table->head_symbol;
01718            entry_symbol != NULL; entry_symbol = entry_symbol->next_symbol)
01719         {
01720           /* Get the entry for ease of use */
01721           entry = (MD_Entry *) entry_symbol->data;
01722 
01723           /* Write out each entries name */
01724 #if 0
01725           fprintf (out, "%i %s\n", entry_symbol->symbol_id, entry->name);
01726 #endif
01727           fprintf (out, "%s\n", entry->name);
01728 
01729         }
01730 
01731       putc ('\n', out);
01732     }
01733   putc ('\n', out);
01734 
01735   /*
01736    * Write out the section's contents
01737    */
01738   for (section_symbol = md->section_table->head_symbol;
01739        section_symbol != NULL; section_symbol = section_symbol->next_symbol)
01740     {
01741       /* Get the section for ease of use */
01742       section = (MD_Section *) section_symbol->data;
01743 
01744       /* Again write how many entries and field declarations there
01745        * are in the section 
01746        */
01747 #if 0
01748       fprintf (out, "%i %s %i %i\n", section_symbol->symbol_id,
01749                section->name,
01750                section->entry_table->symbol_count,
01751                section->field_decl_table->symbol_count);
01752 #endif
01753       fprintf (out, "%s\n%x %x\n",
01754                section->name,
01755                section->entry_table->symbol_count,
01756                section->field_decl_table->symbol_count);
01757 
01758       for (field_decl_symbol = section->field_decl_table->head_symbol;
01759            field_decl_symbol != NULL;
01760            field_decl_symbol = field_decl_symbol->next_symbol)
01761         {
01762           /* Get the field declaration from the symbol */
01763           field_decl = (MD_Field_Decl *) field_decl_symbol->data;
01764 
01765           switch (field_decl->type)
01766             {
01767             case MD_REQUIRED_FIELD:
01768               type_marker = 'R';
01769               break;
01770 
01771             case MD_OPTIONAL_FIELD:
01772               type_marker = 'O';
01773               break;
01774 
01775             default:
01776               MD_punt (NULL, "MD_write_md: Unknown field decl type '%i'.",
01777                        field_decl->type);
01778             }
01779 
01780           if (field_decl->kleene_starred_req != NULL)
01781             kleene_marker = '*';
01782           else
01783             kleene_marker = '-';
01784 
01785 
01786           /* Get values into local variables for ease of use */
01787           max_require_index = field_decl->max_require_index;
01788           require_array = field_decl->require;
01789 
01790           /* Print out the field name and the number of
01791            * required fields
01792            */
01793 #if 0
01794           fprintf (out, "%i %s %i %c\n", field_decl_symbol->symbol_id,
01795                    field_decl->name, max_require_index + 1, kleene_marker);
01796 #endif
01797           fprintf (out, "%s\n%c %x %c\n",
01798                    field_decl->name,
01799                    type_marker, max_require_index + 1, kleene_marker);
01800 
01801           for (require_index = 0; require_index <= max_require_index;
01802                require_index++)
01803             {
01804               element_req = require_array[require_index];
01805 
01806               switch (element_req->type)
01807                 {
01808                 case MD_INT:
01809                   putc ('I', out);
01810                   putc ('\n', out);
01811                   break;
01812 
01813                 case MD_DOUBLE:
01814                   putc ('D', out);
01815                   putc ('\n', out);
01816                   break;
01817 
01818                 case MD_STRING:
01819                   putc ('S', out);
01820                   putc ('\n', out);
01821                   break;
01822 
01823                 case MD_BLOCK:
01824                   putc ('B', out);
01825                   putc ('\n', out);
01826                   break;
01827 
01828                 case MD_LINK:
01829                   link_array = element_req->link;
01830                   link_array_size = element_req->link_array_size;
01831                   fprintf (out, "L %x", link_array_size);
01832                   for (i = 0; i < link_array_size; i++)
01833                     fprintf (out, " %x", link_array[i]->symbol->symbol_id);
01834                   putc ('\n', out);
01835                   break;
01836 
01837                 default:
01838                   MD_punt (NULL, "MD_write_md: Unknown req type %i",
01839                            element_req->type);
01840                 }
01841 
01842             }
01843           putc ('\n', out);
01844         }
01845 
01846       /* Get values into local variables for ease of use */
01847       max_field_index = section->max_field_index;
01848 
01849       /* Print out the field contents for each field */
01850       for (entry_symbol = section->entry_table->head_symbol;
01851            entry_symbol != NULL; entry_symbol = entry_symbol->next_symbol)
01852         {
01853           /* Get the entry for ease of use */
01854           entry = (MD_Entry *) entry_symbol->data;
01855 
01856           /* Get the field array for ease of use */
01857           field_array = entry->field;
01858 
01859           /* Count the number of fields defined for this entry */
01860           field_count = 0;
01861           for (i = 0; i <= max_field_index; i++)
01862             {
01863               if (field_array[i] != NULL)
01864                 field_count++;
01865             }
01866 
01867           /* Write out header for each entry, specifying the
01868            * number of fields defined for each entry
01869            */
01870 #if 0
01871           fprintf (out, "%i %i\n", entry_symbol->symbol_id, field_count);
01872 #endif
01873 
01874           fprintf (out, "%x\n\n", field_count);
01875 
01876           for (field_decl_symbol = section->field_decl_table->head_symbol;
01877                field_decl_symbol != NULL;
01878                field_decl_symbol = field_decl_symbol->next_symbol)
01879             {
01880               /* Get the field declaration from the symbol */
01881               field_decl = (MD_Field_Decl *) field_decl_symbol->data;
01882 
01883               field = field_array[field_decl->field_index];
01884 
01885               if (field == NULL)
01886                 continue;
01887 
01888               /* Get element array for ease of use */
01889               element_array = field->element;
01890 
01891               /* Find the max assigned element index */
01892               for (max_assigned_index = field->max_element_index;
01893                    max_assigned_index >= 0; max_assigned_index--)
01894                 {
01895                   if (element_array[max_assigned_index] != NULL)
01896                     break;
01897                 }
01898 
01899               /* Print out field header, specifying field symbol id,
01900                * and the number of elements specified
01901                */
01902               fprintf (out, "%x %x\n",
01903                        field_decl_symbol->symbol_id, max_assigned_index + 1);
01904 
01905               for (i = 0; i <= max_assigned_index; i++)
01906                 {
01907                   /* Get element for ease of use */
01908                   element = element_array[i];
01909 
01910                   if (element == NULL)
01911                     {
01912                       fprintf (out, "-\n");
01913                     }
01914                   else
01915                     {
01916                       switch (element->type)
01917                         {
01918                           /* Print int elements as signed hex numbers */
01919                         case MD_INT:
01920                           if (element->value.i < 0)
01921                             fprintf (out, "I-%x\n", -element->value.i);
01922                           else
01923                             fprintf (out, "I%x\n", element->value.i);
01924 
01925                           break;
01926 
01927                         case MD_DOUBLE:
01928                           fprintf (out, "D%0.16g\n", element->value.d);
01929                           break;
01930 
01931                         case MD_STRING:
01932                           fprintf (out, "S%s\n", element->value.s);
01933                           break;
01934 
01935                         case MD_BLOCK:
01936                           /* Get block size for ease of use */
01937                           block_size = element->value.b.size;
01938 
01939                           /* Print out contents of binary block in
01940                            * 'binary', prefixed by the size of the block
01941                            * in hex (i.e., 'Bsize binary_data\n')
01942                            * 
01943                            * This data is not platform independent anyway,
01944                            * so I didn't see the benefit from converting
01945                            * to ascii like I did with the other data 
01946                            * types. -JCG 1/15/98
01947                            */
01948                           fprintf (out, "B%x ", block_size);
01949 
01950                           /* Write out binary data */
01951                           fwrite (element->value.b.ptr, block_size, 1, out);
01952 
01953                           /* End with newline like normal */
01954                           putc ('\n', out);
01955                           break;
01956 
01957                         case MD_LINK:
01958                           fprintf (out, "L%x\n",
01959                                    element->value.l->symbol->symbol_id);
01960                           break;
01961 
01962                         default:
01963                           MD_punt (NULL,
01964                                    "MD_write_md: Unknown element type %i.",
01965                                    element->type);
01966                         }
01967                     }
01968                 }
01969 
01970               putc ('\n', out);
01971             }
01972         }
01973 
01974       putc ('\n', out);
01975 
01976     }
01977   putc ('\n', out);
01978 
01979   /* Flush output to make result available right away -JCG 7/29/97 */
01980   fflush (out);
01981 }
01982 
01983 /* Prints the md's contents to out in text format */
01984 void
01985 MD_print_md (FILE * out, MD * md, int page_width)
01986 {
01987   MD_Section *section;
01988   MD_Symbol *symbol;
01989 
01990   /* Print header for this md (as comment) */
01991   fprintf (out, "/*\n * %s:\n", md->name);
01992   fprintf (out,
01993            " *    Field declarations and entry contents for each section\n");
01994   fprintf (out, " */");
01995 
01996   /* Print out each section in the md */
01997   for (symbol = md->section_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
01998        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
01999     {
02000       /* Get the section for ease of use */
02001       section = (MD_Section *) symbol->data;
02002 
02003       putc ('\n', out);
02004 
02005       /* Print out the section */
02006       MD_print_section (out, section, page_width);
02007     }
02008 
02009   /* Flush output to make result available right away -JCG 7/29/97 */
02010   fflush (out);
02011 }
02012 
02013 /*
02014  * Prints the section and entry declarations required to make the output of 
02015  * MD_print_md a valid hmdes file.  These declarations resolve the 
02016  * problem of circular LINKs that can occur between entries in md files.   
02017  * Print out all sections and entries (verses the minimum subset required)
02018  * to preserve section and entry order in md.
02019  * 
02020  * Print in a compact format since these declarationcs are not very 
02021  * informative.
02022  */
02023 void
02024 MD_print_md_declarations (FILE * out, MD * md, int page_width)
02025 {
02026   MD_Section *section;
02027   MD_Entry *entry, *next_entry;
02028   char *entry_name;
02029   int col, legal_ident, name_len;
02030   int comment_indent, cur_indent;
02031 
02032 
02033   /* Print header for this md (as comment) */
02034   fprintf (out, "/*\n * %s:\n", md->name);
02035   fprintf (out, " *   Declaration of all section and entry names\n */");
02036 
02037   /* Determine where to print the '// Declaration' comment. 
02038    * Put it near column 39 unless page_width is too narrow.
02039    */
02040   comment_indent = 39;
02041   if (comment_indent > (page_width - 16))
02042     comment_indent = page_width - 16;
02043 
02044   /* Create each section in order */
02045   for (section = MD_first_section (md); section != NULL;
02046        section = MD_next_section (section))
02047     {
02048       fprintf (out, "\nCREATE SECTION %s", section->name);
02049 
02050       /* Calculate current indentation */
02051       cur_indent = 15 + strlen (section->name);
02052 
02053       /* Pad with spaces */
02054       while (cur_indent < comment_indent)
02055         {
02056           putc (' ', out);
02057           cur_indent++;
02058         }
02059 
02060       /* Print comment */
02061       fprintf (out, " // Declaration\n");
02062       fprintf (out, "{\n");
02063 
02064       /* Start out in column 0 */
02065       col = 0;
02066 
02067       /* Declare all the entries in each section */
02068       for (entry = MD_first_entry (section); entry != NULL;
02069            entry = next_entry)
02070         {
02071           /* Get next entry now for newline processing later */
02072           next_entry = MD_next_entry (entry);
02073 
02074           /* Get entry name for ease of use */
02075           entry_name = entry->name;
02076 
02077           /* Get length of name */
02078           name_len = strlen (entry_name);
02079 
02080           /* Is it a legal identifier? */
02081           legal_ident = MD_legal_ident (entry_name);
02082 
02083           /* If not a legal identifier, name will be two characters longer */
02084           if (!legal_ident)
02085             name_len += 2;
02086 
02087           /* Do we need to go to a newline before we print this name?
02088            * (yes if not at beginning of line and will go past page_width)
02089            */
02090           if ((col != 0) && (col + name_len + 4) >= page_width)
02091             {
02092               putc ('\n', out);
02093               col = 0;
02094             }
02095 
02096           /* Put extra space at beginning of each line */
02097           if (col == 0)
02098             {
02099               putc (' ', out);
02100               col = 1;
02101             }
02102 
02103           /* Print out the entry name (with quotes if not a legal ident) */
02104           if (!MD_legal_ident (entry_name))
02105             {
02106               fprintf (out, " '%s'();", entry_name);
02107             }
02108           else
02109             {
02110               fprintf (out, " %s();", entry_name);
02111             }
02112           col += name_len + 4;
02113 
02114         }
02115 
02116       putc ('\n', out);
02117       putc ('}', out);
02118       putc ('\n', out);
02119     }
02120 
02121 
02122 
02123 }
02124 
02125 /* Prints the section and entry names in the md */
02126 void
02127 MD_print_md_template (FILE * out, MD * md)
02128 {
02129   MD_Section *section;
02130   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02131   int first_section;
02132 
02133   /* Print header for this md (as comment) */
02134   fprintf (out, "/*\n * %s template\n */\n", md->name);
02135 
02136   /* Mark that we are about to print out the first section */
02137   first_section = 1;
02138 
02139   /* Print out each section in the md */
02140   for (symbol = md->section_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
02141        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
02142     {
02143       /* Get the section for ease of use */
02144       section = (MD_Section *) symbol->data;
02145 
02146       /* Print a newline before the section if not the first section */
02147       if (!first_section)
02148         putc ('\n', out);
02149 
02150       /* Otherwise, mark that next section is not the first section */
02151       else
02152         first_section = 0;
02153 
02154       /* Print out the section name and section entry's names */
02155       MD_print_section_template (out, section);
02156     }
02157 }
02158 
02159 
02160 /* Creates a new section in the md with an initial size suitable for the 
02161  * specified number of entries and number of fields.  The section 
02162  * automatically resizes (upward) when appropriate, so 0 entries and/or
02163  * 0 may be specified.
02164  */
02165 MD_Section *
02166 MD_new_section (MD * md, char *name, int num_entries, int num_fields)
02167 {
02168   MD_Section *section;
02169   char *field_decl_desc, *entry_desc;
02170 
02171   /* Allocate a new section structure */
02172   section = (MD_Section *) L_alloc (MD_Section_pool);
02173 
02174   /* Initialize the section's fields */
02175   section->md = md;
02176   section->name = MD_strdup (name);
02177 
02178   /* Initialize user's extension pointer to NULL */
02179   section->user_ext = NULL;
02180 
02181   /* Create a symbol table for this section's entries.
02182    * Create a good description, so symbol table error messages
02183    * (such as two symbol's with same name) are intelligible.
02184    */
02185   entry_desc = MD_concat_strings (name, "'s entry table");
02186   section->entry_table = MD_new_symbol_table (md, entry_desc, num_entries);
02187   free (entry_desc);
02188 
02189 
02190   /* Create a symbol table for this section's field declarations.
02191    * Create a good description, so symbol table error messages
02192    * (such as two symbol's with same name) are intelligible.
02193    */
02194   field_decl_desc = MD_concat_strings (name, "'s field declaration table");
02195   section->field_decl_table = MD_new_symbol_table (md, field_decl_desc,
02196                                                    num_fields);
02197   free (field_decl_desc);
02198 
02199   /* Initialize field decl fields to 0 fields then resize using
02200    * num_fields to get intial size specified in num_fields.
02201    */
02202   section->max_field_index = -1;
02203   section->field_decl = NULL;
02204   section->field_array_size = 0;
02205 
02206   /* Resize the array based on num_fields unless num_fields is specified
02207    * as 0.  (The entry_table must be built before this is called).
02208    */
02209   if (num_fields != 0)
02210     {
02211       MD_resize_field_arrays (section, num_fields);
02212     }
02213 
02214 
02215   /* Add section to the md's section table, place pointer of added
02216    * symbol into section structure for easy access.
02217    */
02218   section->symbol = MD_add_symbol (md->section_table, section->name,
02219                                    (void *) section);
02220 
02221   /* Return the new section */
02222   return (section);
02223 }
02224 
02225 /*
02226  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_num_sections()!
02227  * This is the function version of the macro MD_num_sections().
02228  * 
02229  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macros.
02230  */
02231 int
02232 _MD_num_sections (MD * md)
02233 {
02234   /* Return number of sections found in the md's section table */
02235   return (md->section_table->symbol_count);
02236 }
02237 
02238 /*
02239  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_find_section()!
02240  * This is the function version of the macro MD_find_section().
02241  * 
02242  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macros.
02243  */
02244 MD_Section *
02245 _MD_find_section (MD * md, char *name)
02246 {
02247   /* Find section in md table, return data cast as MD_Section */
02248   return ((MD_Section *) _MD_find_symbol_data (md->section_table, name));
02249 }
02250 
02251 /*
02252  * Returns a pointer to the first section in the MD or NULL if MD empty.
02253  */
02254 MD_Section *
02255 MD_first_section (MD * md)
02256 {
02257   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02258 
02259   symbol = md->section_table->head_symbol;
02260 
02261   if (symbol != NULL)
02262     return ((MD_Section *) symbol->data);
02263   else
02264     return (NULL);
02265 }
02266 
02267 /*
02268  * Returns a pointer to the last section in the MD or NULL if MD empty.
02269  */
02270 MD_Section *
02271 MD_last_section (MD * md)
02272 {
02273   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02274 
02275   symbol = md->section_table->tail_symbol;
02276 
02277   if (symbol != NULL)
02278     return ((MD_Section *) symbol->data);
02279   else
02280     return (NULL);
02281 }
02282 
02283 /* 
02284  * Returns a pointer to the next section in the MD or NULL if passed 
02285  * a pointer to the last section in the MD.
02286  */
02287 MD_Section *
02288 MD_next_section (MD_Section * section)
02289 {
02290   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02291 
02292   symbol = section->symbol->next_symbol;
02293 
02294   if (symbol != NULL)
02295     return ((MD_Section *) symbol->data);
02296   else
02297     return (NULL);
02298 }
02299 
02300 /* 
02301  * Returns a pointer to the previous section in the MD or NULL if passed 
02302  * a pointer to the first section in the MD.
02303  */
02304 MD_Section *
02305 MD_prev_section (MD_Section * section)
02306 {
02307   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02308 
02309   symbol = section->symbol->prev_symbol;
02310 
02311   if (symbol != NULL)
02312     return ((MD_Section *) symbol->data);
02313   else
02314     return (NULL);
02315 }
02316 
02317 /*
02318  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_set_section_ext()! 
02319  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_section_ext().
02320  * 
02321  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macro.
02322  */
02323 void *
02324 _MD_set_section_ext (MD_Section * section, void *ext)
02325 {
02326   section->user_ext = ext;
02327 
02328   /* Return ext to be equivalent to macro version */
02329   return (ext);
02330 }
02331 
02332 /*
02333  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_get_section_ext()!
02334  * This is the function version of the macro MD_get_section_ext().
02335  * 
02336  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macro.
02337  */
02338 void *
02339 _MD_get_section_ext (MD_Section * section)
02340 {
02341   return (section->user_ext);
02342 }
02343 
02344 /* 
02345  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_delete_section()!
02346  * Frees the memory associated with a section.
02347  * Used by MD_delete_section macro and MD_delete_md.
02348  * 
02349  * Assumes section has already been removed from the 
02350  * md's section_table.
02351  */
02352 void
02353 _MD_free_section (MD_Section * section)
02354 {
02355   char *name;
02356 
02357   /* Free name last (for error messages) */
02358   name = section->name;
02359 
02360   /* Free entry symbol table and all the information contained in it. */
02361   MD_delete_symbol_table (section->entry_table,
02362                           (void (*)(void *)) _MD_free_entry);
02363 
02364   /* Free field declaration table and all the information contained in it.
02365    * Must be called after freeing entries because the free entry
02366    * routine uses the field declaration
02367    */
02368   MD_delete_symbol_table (section->field_decl_table,
02369                           (void (*)(void *)) _MD_free_field_decl);
02370 
02371   /* Free the field_decl array (if it exists) */
02372   if (section->field_decl != NULL)
02373     free (section->field_decl);
02374 
02375   /* Free the section structure */
02376   L_free (MD_Section_pool, section);
02377 
02378   /* Free the section's name */
02379   free (name);
02380 }
02381 
02382 /*
02383  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_delete_section()!
02384  * This is the function version of the macro MD_delete_section().
02385  * 
02386  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macro.
02387  */
02388 void
02389 _MD_delete_section (MD_Section * section)
02390 {
02391   /* Delete symbol and structure memory */
02392   MD_delete_symbol (section->symbol, (void (*)(void *)) _MD_free_section);
02393 }
02394 
02395 
02396 /*
02397  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_check_section()!
02398  * This function checks the elements in the specified section.
02399  * Used by the MD_check_section() macro and MD_check_md().
02400  * 
02401  * Returns the number of required fields not specified + the 
02402  * number of elements with incorrect type in the section (0 if all ok).
02403  * 
02404  * If out is non-NULL, warning messages for non-specified required field
02405  * and for each element with incorrect type will be printed to out.
02406  *
02407  * The caller_name is used in the warning messages to identify the
02408  * routine/macro that started the checking process (MD_check_md or
02409  * MD_check_section).
02410  */
02411 int
02412 _MD_check_section (FILE * out, MD_Section * section, char *caller_name)
02413 {
02414   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02415   MD_Entry *entry;
02416   int error_count;
02417 
02418   /* Initialize error count */
02419   error_count = 0;
02420 
02421   /* Scan every entry in the section for errors */
02422   for (symbol = section->entry_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
02423        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
02424     {
02425       /* Get the entry pointed to by this symbol */
02426       entry = (MD_Entry *) symbol->data;
02427 
02428       /* Sum up all the errors found by check entry */
02429       error_count += _MD_check_entry (out, entry, caller_name);
02430     }
02431 
02432 
02433   /* Return the number of errors found in the section */
02434   return (error_count);
02435 }
02436 
02437 /* Prints the section's contents to out in text format */
02438 void
02439 MD_print_section (FILE * out, MD_Section * section, int page_width)
02440 {
02441   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
02442   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02443   MD_Entry *entry;
02444 
02445   fprintf (out, "SECTION %s\n", section->name);
02446   /* Print every field declaration in section */
02447   for (symbol = section->field_decl_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
02448        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
02449     {
02450       /* Get the field_decl pointed to by this symbol */
02451       field_decl = (MD_Field_Decl *) symbol->data;
02452 
02453       /* Print the field declaration */
02454       MD_print_field_decl (out, field_decl, page_width);
02455     }
02456   fprintf (out, "{\n");
02457 
02458   /* Print every entry in section */
02459   for (symbol = section->entry_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
02460        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
02461     {
02462       /* Get the entry pointed to by this symbol */
02463       entry = (MD_Entry *) symbol->data;
02464 
02465       /* Print the entry */
02466       MD_print_entry (out, entry, page_width);
02467     }
02468 
02469   fprintf (out, "}\n");
02470 }
02471 
02472 /* Prints the section's entry names (only) in text format */
02473 void
02474 MD_print_section_template (FILE * out, MD_Section * section)
02475 {
02476   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02477   MD_Entry *entry;
02478 
02479   fprintf (out, "SECTION %s\n{\n", section->name);
02480 
02481   /* Print every entry in section */
02482   for (symbol = section->entry_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
02483        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
02484     {
02485       /* Get the entry pointed to by this symbol */
02486       entry = (MD_Entry *) symbol->data;
02487 
02488       /* Print the entry */
02489       MD_print_entry_template (out, entry);
02490     }
02491 
02492   fprintf (out, "}\n");
02493 }
02494 
02495 /* 
02496  * Creates a new entry in a section. 
02497  */
02498 MD_Entry *
02499 MD_new_entry (MD_Section * section, char *name)
02500 {
02501   MD_Entry *entry;
02502   int field_array_size;
02503   MD_Field **field_array;
02504   int i;
02505 
02506   /* Allocate a new entry structure */
02507   entry = (MD_Entry *) L_alloc (MD_Entry_pool);
02508 
02509   /* Initialize the entry's fields */
02510   entry->section = section;
02511   entry->name = MD_strdup (name);
02512 
02513   /* Initialize user's extension pointer to NULL */
02514   entry->user_ext = NULL;
02515 
02516   /* Get field array size from section for ease of use */
02517   field_array_size = section->field_array_size;
02518 
02519   /* Allocate field array if at least one field has been declared */
02520   if (field_array_size > 0)
02521     {
02522       field_array = (MD_Field **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Field *) *
02523                                           field_array_size);
02524       if (field_array == NULL)
02525         {
02526           MD_punt (section->md, "MD_new_entry: Out of memory (size %i)",
02527                    field_array_size);
02528         }
02529 
02530       /* Initialize field array with NULL pointers */
02531       for (i = 0; i < field_array_size; i++)
02532         field_array[i] = NULL;
02533 
02534       /* Point field at new field array */
02535       entry->field = field_array;
02536     }
02537 
02538   /* Otherwise, point field array at NULL */
02539   else
02540     {
02541       entry->field = NULL;
02542     }
02543 
02544   /* Add entry to the section's entry table, place pointer of added
02545    * symbol into entry structure for easy access.
02546    */
02547   entry->symbol = MD_add_symbol (section->entry_table, entry->name,
02548                                  (void *) entry);
02549 
02550   /* Return the new entry */
02551   return (entry);
02552 }
02553 
02554 /* Renames the entry but otherwise the entry is unchanged */
02555 void
02556 MD_rename_entry (MD_Entry * entry, char *new_name)
02557 {
02558   char *old_name;
02559 
02560   /* Rename entry but don't free old_name yet.  The symbol is still
02561    * pointing to the old name, and it cannot be freed until after
02562    * MD_rename_symbol!
02563    */
02564   old_name = entry->name;
02565   entry->name = MD_strdup (new_name);
02566 
02567   /* Rename in the symbol table (will point at entry->name, not a copy) */
02568   MD_rename_symbol (entry->symbol, entry->name);
02569 
02570   /* Free old name now that it is safe to do so */
02571   free (old_name);
02572 }
02573 
02574 /*
02575  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_num_entries()!
02576  * This is the function version of the macro MD_num_entries().
02577  * 
02578  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macros.
02579  */
02580 int
02581 _MD_num_entries (MD_Section * section)
02582 {
02583   /* Return number of entries found in the section's entry table */
02584   return (section->entry_table->symbol_count);
02585 }
02586 
02587 /*
02588  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_find_entry()!
02589  * This is the function version of the macro MD_find_entry().
02590  * 
02591  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macros.
02592  */
02593 MD_Entry *
02594 _MD_find_entry (MD_Section * section, char *name)
02595 {
02596   /* Find entry in section table, return data cast as MD_Entry */
02597   return ((MD_Entry *) _MD_find_symbol_data (section->entry_table, name));
02598 }

02607   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02608 
02609   symbol = section->entry_table->head_symbol;
02610 
02611   if (symbol != NULL)
02612     return ((MD_Entry *) symbol->data);
02613   else
02614     return (NULL);
02615 }

02617 /*
02618  * Returns a pointer to the last entry in the section or NULL if the section
02619  * is empty.
02620  */
02621 MD_Entry *
02622 MD_last_entry (MD_Section * section)
02623 {
02624   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02625 
02626   symbol = section->entry_table->tail_symbol;

02629     return ((MD_Entry *) symbol->data);
02630   else
02631     return (NULL);

02640 {
02641   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02642

02646     return ((MD_Entry *) symbol->data);

02668 /*
02669  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_set_entry_ext()! 
02670  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_entry_ext().
02671  * 
02672  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macro.
02673  */
02674 void *

02683 /*
02684  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_get_entry_ext()!
02685  * This is the function version of the macro MD_get_entry_ext().
02686  * 
02687  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macro.

02689 void *
02690 _MD_get_entry_ext (MD_Entry * entry)
