02694 
02695 /* 
02696  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_delete_entry()!
02697  * Frees the memory associated with a entry.
02698  * Used by MD_delete_entry macro and MD_delete_section.
02699  * 
02700  * Assumes entry has already been removed from the 
02701  * section's entry_table.
02702  */
02703 void
02704 _MD_free_entry (MD_Entry * entry)
02705 {
02706   char *name;
02707   int field_index, max_field_index;
02708   MD_Field **field_array, *field;
02709 
02710   /* Free name last (for error messages) */
02711   name = entry->name;
02712 
02713   /* Get the max_field_index and field array for ease of use */
02714   max_field_index = entry->section->max_field_index;
02715   field_array = entry->field;
02716 
02717   /* Free all the fields specified in field_array, 
02718    * Assumes max_field_index == -1 if field_array is NULL
02719    */
02720   for (field_index = 0; field_index <= max_field_index; field_index++)
02721     {
02722       field = field_array[field_index];
02723       if (field != NULL)
02724         MD_delete_field (field);
02725     }
02726 
02727   /* Free the field array (if exists) */
02728   if (field_array != NULL)
02729     free (field_array);
02730 
02731   /* Free the entry structure */
02732   L_free (MD_Entry_pool, entry);
02733 
02734   /* Free the entry's name */
02735   free (name);
02736 }
02737 
02738 /*
02739  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_delete_entry()!
02740  * This is the function version of the macro MD_delete_entry().
02741  * 
02742  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macro.
02743  */
02744 void
02745 _MD_delete_entry (MD_Entry * entry)
02746 {
02747   /* Delete symbol and structure memory */
02748   MD_delete_symbol (entry->symbol, (void (*)(void *)) _MD_free_entry);
02749 }
02750 
02751 /*
02752  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_check_entry()!
02753  * This function checks the elements in the specified entry.
02754  * Used by the MD_check_entry() macro and _MD_check_section().
02755  * 
02756  * Returns the number of required fields not specified + the 
02757  * number of elements with incorrect type (0 if all ok).
02758  * 
02759  * If out is non-NULL, warning messages for non-specified required field
02760  * and for each element with incorrect type will be printed to out.
02761  *
02762  * The caller_name is used in the warning messages to identify the
02763  * routine/macro that started the checking process (MD_check_md, 
02764  * MD_check_section, or MD_check_entry).
02765  */
02766 int
02767 _MD_check_entry (FILE * out, MD_Entry * entry, char *caller_name)
02768 {
02769   MD_Section *section;
02770   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl, **field_decl_array;
02771   MD_Field *field;
02772   int max_field_index, field_index;
02773   int error_count;
02774 
02775   /* Initialize the error count */
02776   error_count = 0;
02777 
02778   /* Get the various pointers into local variables for ease of use */
02779   section = entry->section;
02780   field_decl_array = section->field_decl;
02781   max_field_index = section->max_field_index;
02782 
02783   /* Check all the fields in the array */
02784   for (field_index = 0; field_index <= max_field_index; field_index++)
02785     {
02786       /* Get the field declaration for this field */
02787       field_decl = field_decl_array[field_index];
02788 
02789       /* If there is no field declared for this index, goto next index */
02790       if (field_decl == NULL)
02791         continue;
02792 
02793       /* Get the entry's field at this index */
02794       field = entry->field[field_index];
02795 
02796       /* Check the elements in the field if it exists */
02797       if (field != NULL)
02798         {
02799           /* Add in any error found by check_field */
02800           error_count += _MD_check_field (out, field, caller_name);
02801         }
02802 
02803       /* Otherwise warn if this field is required to be present */
02804       else if (field_decl->type == MD_REQUIRED_FIELD)
02805         {
02806           error_count++;
02807           if (out != NULL)
02808             {
02809               MD_warn (out,
02810                        "%s(%s->%s->%s):\n  Warning, required field '%s' "
02811                        "unspecified for entry '%s'.",
02812                        caller_name, section->name, entry->name,
02813                        field_decl->name, field_decl->name, entry->name);
02814             }
02815         }
02816     }
02817 
02818   /* Return the number of errors detected */
02819   return (error_count);
02820 }
02821 
02822 /* Returns 1 if a legal identifier (C identifier), 0 otherwise */
02823 static int
02824 MD_legal_ident (char *ident)
02825 {
02826 
02827   char *ptr;
02828 
02829   /* Must start with letter of '_' (may not be empty string) */
02830   if ((ident[0] != '_') && !isalpha (ident[0]))
02831     return (0);
02832 
02833   /* Rest of string must be alphnumeric or '_' */
02834   for (ptr = &ident[1]; *ptr != 0; ptr++)
02835     {
02836       if ((*ptr != '_') && !isalnum (*ptr))
02837         return (0);
02838     }
02839 
02840   /* Return legal */
02841   return (1);
02842 }
02843 
02844 /* Prints out a textual representation of the entry to out 
02845  * Called by MD_print_section().
02846  */
02847 void
02848 MD_print_entry (FILE * out, MD_Entry * entry, int page_width)
02849 {
02850   MD_Field **field_array, *field;
02851   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
02852   MD_Symbol *symbol;
02853   MD_Section *section;
02854   MD_Element **element_array, *element;
02855   char *entry_name, *field_name, *link_name;
02856   int effective_name_len, field_name_indent, first_field;
02857   int element_value_indent, value_len = 0, print_column;
02858   int element_index, first_element;
02859   int max_assigned_index, link_valid_ident = 0;
02860   unsigned int block_size, block_index, block_byte, nibble, nibble_char;
02861   unsigned char *block_ptr;
02862   char value_buf[500];
02863   int i;
02864 
02865   /* Set the indentation for the field names.
02866    * A setting of 17 allows names of length 14 on the same line
02867    * as first field.  Also puts openning '(' at 2 tabs in.
02868    */
02869   field_name_indent = 17;
02870 
02871   /* Get pointers for ease of use */
02872   entry_name = entry->name;
02873   field_array = entry->field;
02874   section = entry->section;
02875 
02876   /* Print out the entry name (with quotes if not a legal identifier) */
02877   if (!MD_legal_ident (entry_name))
02878     {
02879       fprintf (out, "  '%s'", entry_name);
02880 
02881       /* Calculate the effective entry name length 
02882        * (name_len + 2 for indent, 2 for quotes)
02883        */
02884       effective_name_len = strlen (entry_name) + 4;
02885     }
02886   else
02887     {
02888       fprintf (out, "  %s", entry_name);
02889 
02890       /* Calculate the effective entry name length 
02891        * (name_len + 2 for indent)
02892        */
02893       effective_name_len = strlen (entry_name) + 2;
02894     }
02895 
02896   /* Determine if can place first field on same line as entry name 
02897    * (Want to place a '(' after the entry name)
02898    */
02899   if ((effective_name_len + 1) > field_name_indent)
02900     {
02901       /* No, force newline and indent */
02902       putc ('\n', out);
02903 
02904       /* Indent, leaving space for '(' */
02905       for (i = 1; i < field_name_indent; i++)
02906         putc (' ', out);
02907     }
02908   else
02909     {
02910       /* Yes, pad to place to place '(' */
02911       for (i = effective_name_len + 1; i < field_name_indent; i++)
02912         putc (' ', out);
02913     }
02914 
02915   /* Put the opening '(' */
02916   putc ('(', out);
02917 
02918   /* Mark that we are about to process the first field */
02919   first_field = 1;
02920 
02921   /* Print out fields in the order declared 
02922    * (verses the order they are in the field table)
02923    */
02924   for (symbol = section->field_decl_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
02925        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
02926     {
02927       /* Get the field declaration for this symbol */
02928       field_decl = (MD_Field_Decl *) symbol->data;
02929 
02930       /* Get the entry's field for this declaration */
02931       field = field_array[field_decl->field_index];
02932 
02933       /* If field has not been specified for this entry, goto next field */
02934       if (field == NULL)
02935         continue;
02936 
02937       /* Need to indent field name if this is not the first field */
02938       if (!first_field)
02939         {
02940           /* Goto next line */
02941           putc ('\n', out);
02942 
02943           /* Indent field name */
02944           for (i = 0; i < field_name_indent; i++)
02945             putc (' ', out);
02946         }
02947       /* Otherwise mark that next field will not be the first field */
02948       else
02949         {
02950           first_field = 0;
02951         }
02952 
02953       /* Get the field name for ease of use */
02954       field_name = field_decl->name;
02955 
02956       /* Get where all the element values should be indented (if needed) */
02957       element_value_indent = field_name_indent + strlen (field_name) + 1;
02958 
02959       /* Print the field's name and opening '(' */
02960       fprintf (out, "%s(", field_name);
02961 
02962       /* Set our print column to the current position */
02963       print_column = element_value_indent;
02964 
02965       /* Get the element array for ease of use */
02966       element_array = field->element;
02967 
02968       /* Make max_assigned_index point at the last element set to a value */
02969       max_assigned_index = field->max_element_index;
02970       while ((max_assigned_index >= 0) &&
02971              (element_array[max_assigned_index] == NULL))
02972         max_assigned_index--;
02973 
02974       /* Mark that we are about to print the first element value 
02975        * on this line
02976        */
02977       first_element = 1;
02978 
02979       /* Print out all the element values for this field */
02980       for (element_index = 0; element_index <= max_assigned_index;
02981            element_index++)
02982         {
02983           /* Get the element for ease of use */
02984           element = element_array[element_index];
02985 
02986           /* Calculate the length of the value for this element.
02987            * Place the string for INT and DOUBLE in value_buf.
02988            */
02989           if (element == NULL)
02990             value_len = 2;
02991           else
02992             {
02993               switch (element->type)
02994                 {
02995                 case MD_INT:
02996                   /* Print int to buffer */
02997                   sprintf (value_buf, "%i", element->value.i);
02998                   value_len = strlen (value_buf);
02999                   break;
03000 
03001                 case MD_DOUBLE:
03002                   /* Print double to buffer with 10 trailing digits
03003                    * of precision and strip off trailing zeros 
03004                    * (min 1 trailing zero)
03005                    */
03006                   sprintf (value_buf, "%.10f", element->value.d);
03007                   value_len = strlen (value_buf);
03008                   while (value_len >= 2)
03009                     {
03010                       /* Stop at first non-zero value hit or
03011                        * at one zero before decimal
03012                        */
03013                       if ((value_buf[value_len - 1] != '0') ||
03014                           (value_buf[value_len - 2] == '.'))
03015                         break;
03016 
03017                       /* Remove trailing zero */
03018                       value_len--;
03019                       value_buf[value_len] = 0;
03020                     }
03021                   break;
03022 
03023                 case MD_STRING:
03024                   /* Will need quotes around string */
03025                   value_len = strlen (element->value.s) + 2;
03026                   break;
03027 
03028                 case MD_BLOCK:
03029                   /* Will need single quotes around binary data */
03030                   value_len = element->value.b.size + 2;
03031                   break;
03032 
03033                 case MD_LINK:
03034                   /* Quotes are needed around name if not valid ident */
03035                   link_name = element->value.l->name;
03036                   link_valid_ident = MD_legal_ident (link_name);
03037                   if (link_valid_ident)
03038                     value_len = strlen (link_name);
03039                   else
03040                     value_len = strlen (link_name) + 2;
03041                   break;
03042 
03043                 default:
03044                   MD_punt (entry->section->md,
03045                            "MD_print_entry: Unknown element type '%i'",
03046                            element->type);
03047                 }
03048             }
03049 
03050           /*
03051            * If not first element, see if can fit on this line or if need
03052            * to goto the next line.  
03053            * (Always print first element on same line)
03054            */
03055           if (!first_element)
03056             {
03057               /* See if we will exceed page width if this value is printed
03058                * out, leaving 4 spaces for trailing ')); '
03059                */
03060               if ((print_column + value_len) >= (page_width - 4))
03061                 {
03062                   /* Goto next line */
03063                   putc ('\n', out);
03064 
03065                   /* Indent to element_value_indent */
03066                   for (i = 0; i < element_value_indent; i++)
03067                     putc (' ', out);
03068 
03069                   /* Reset print_column */
03070                   print_column = element_value_indent;
03071                 }
03072 
03073               /* Otherwise, just print space after last value */
03074               else
03075                 {
03076                   putc (' ', out);
03077 
03078                   /* Update print_column */
03079                   print_column++;
03080                 }
03081             }
03082           /* Otherwise mark that next element will not be the first element
03083            * on this line
03084            */
03085           else
03086             {
03087               first_element = 0;
03088             }
03089 
03090           /* Update print column */
03091           print_column += value_len;
03092 
03093 
03094           /* 
03095            * Print out the element's value.
03096            * INT, DOUBLE, and LINK use info from the value_len calculation.
03097            */
03098           if (element == NULL)
03099             {
03100               fprintf (out, "()");
03101               continue;
03102             }
03103 
03104           switch (element->type)
03105             {
03106               /* For INT and DOUBLE, value placed in value buffer */
03107             case MD_INT:
03108             case MD_DOUBLE:
03109               fprintf (out, "%s", value_buf);
03110               break;
03111 
03112             case MD_STRING:
03113               /* Print out string with '"' to identify it as a string */
03114               fprintf (out, "\"%s\"", element->value.s);
03115               break;
03116 
03117             case MD_BLOCK:
03118               /* Print out binary data as a string of hex characters,
03119                * two hex characters per byte.  Put "'" around binary
03120                * data to provide hint that not string data.  However
03121                * it might look like a link (sigh).
03122                */
03123               putc ('\'', out);
03124 
03125               /* Get block size and pointer for ease of use */
03126               block_size = element->value.b.size;
03127               block_ptr = (unsigned char *) element->value.b.ptr;
03128 
03129               /* Print out each byte as two hex characters */
03130               for (block_index = 0; block_index < block_size; block_index++)
03131                 {
03132                   /* Get the byte to print out */
03133                   block_byte = block_ptr[block_index];
03134 
03135                   /* Print out the high nibble */
03136                   nibble = block_byte >> 4;
03137 
03138                   if (nibble < 10)
03139                     nibble_char = '0' + nibble;
03140                   else
03141                     nibble_char = 'a' + (nibble - 10);
03142 
03143                   putc (nibble_char, out);
03144 
03145                   /* Print out the low nibble */
03146                   nibble = block_byte & 0x0f;
03147 
03148                   if (nibble < 10)
03149                     nibble_char = '0' + nibble;
03150                   else
03151                     nibble_char = 'a' + (nibble - 10);
03152 
03153                   putc (nibble_char, out);
03154                 }
03155               putc ('\'', out);
03156               break;
03157 
03158             case MD_LINK:
03159               /* Print out name of entry linked to.  Put "'" around
03160                * name if name not a valid identifier.
03161                */
03162               link_name = element->value.l->name;
03163               if (link_valid_ident)
03164                 fprintf (out, "%s", link_name);
03165               else
03166                 fprintf (out, "'%s'", link_name);
03167               break;
03168 
03169             default:
03170               MD_punt (entry->section->md,
03171                        "MD_print_entry: Unknown element type '%i'",
03172                        element->type);
03173             }
03174         }
03175       /* Closing out field */
03176       fprintf (out, ")");
03177     }
03178 
03179   /* Closing out entry */
03180   fprintf (out, ");\n");
03181 }
03182 
03183 /* Prints out a textual template for the entry (Entry name and (); only).
03184  *
03185  * Useful for listing the entries in a section/md.
03186  *
03187  * Called by MD_print_section_template().
03188  */
03189 void
03190 MD_print_entry_template (FILE * out, MD_Entry * entry)
03191 {
03192   char *entry_name;
03193   int effective_name_len, field_name_indent;
03194   int i;
03195 
03196   /* Set the indentation for the field names.
03197    * A setting of 17 allows names of length 14 on the same line
03198    * as first field.  Also puts openning '(' at 2 tabs in.
03199    */
03200   field_name_indent = 17;
03201 
03202   /* Get pointers for ease of use */
03203   entry_name = entry->name;
03204 
03205   /* Print out the entry name (with quotes if not a legal identifier) */
03206   if (!MD_legal_ident (entry_name))
03207     {
03208       fprintf (out, "  '%s'", entry_name);
03209 
03210       /* Calculate the effective entry name length 
03211        * (name_len + 2 for indent, 2 for quotes)
03212        */
03213       effective_name_len = strlen (entry_name) + 4;
03214     }
03215   else
03216     {
03217       fprintf (out, "  %s", entry_name);
03218 
03219       /* Calculate the effective entry name length 
03220        * (name_len + 2 for indent)
03221        */
03222       effective_name_len = strlen (entry_name) + 2;
03223     }
03224 
03225   /* Always (); on same line as entry name */
03226   /* Pad if necessary */
03227   for (i = effective_name_len + 1; i < field_name_indent; i++)
03228     putc (' ', out);
03229 
03230 
03231   /* Put the opening and closing '();' */
03232   putc ('(', out);
03233   putc (')', out);
03234   putc (';', out);
03235   putc ('\n', out);
03236 }
03237 
03238 /* Creates a new field declaration in the specified section. */
03239 MD_Field_Decl *
03240 MD_new_field_decl (MD_Section * section, char *name, MD_FIELD_TYPE field_type)
03241 {
03242   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl, **decl_array;
03243   int new_index, max_index;
03244 
03245   /* Allocate a new field declaration structure */
03246   field_decl = (MD_Field_Decl *) L_alloc (MD_Field_Decl_pool);
03247 
03248   /* Initialize the field declaration's fields */
03249   field_decl->section = section;
03250   field_decl->name = MD_strdup (name);
03251   field_decl->type = field_type;
03252 
03253   field_decl->max_require_index = -1;
03254   field_decl->require = NULL;   /* Initially no requirements */
03255   field_decl->require_array_size = 0;
03256   field_decl->kleene_starred_req = NULL;        /* Initially no starred
03257                                                    requirement */
03258 
03259   /* Search for next available field index in section */
03260   max_index = section->max_field_index;
03261   decl_array = section->field_decl;
03262   for (new_index = 0; new_index <= max_index; new_index++)
03263     {
03264       /* If slot in field_decl is empty, take it */
03265       if (decl_array[new_index] == NULL)
03266         break;
03267     }
03268 
03269   /* If new index exceeds current array size, resize field_decl array */
03270   if (new_index >= section->field_array_size)
03271     MD_resize_field_arrays (section, new_index);
03272 
03273   /* Place field declaration in new slot
03274    * Must use section->field_decl since the above resize call will change
03275    * the array!
03276    */
03277   section->field_decl[new_index] = field_decl;
03278   field_decl->field_index = new_index;
03279 
03280   /* Update max_field_index if necessary */
03281   if (section->max_field_index < new_index)
03282     section->max_field_index = new_index;
03283 
03284   /* Add to section's field declaration table, place pointer of added
03285    * symbol into section structure for easy access.
03286    */
03287   field_decl->symbol = MD_add_symbol (section->field_decl_table,
03288                                       field_decl->name, (void *) field_decl);
03289 
03290   /* Return the new field declaration */
03291   return (field_decl);
03292 }
03293 
03294 /* Resizes the field_decl array in the section structure
03295  * and the field arrays in all the entries in the section.
03296  * 
03297  * Will allocate an array at least two bigger than what is needed for
03298  * max_index and will always round up to the next even number
03299  * (malloc has to align to a 8 byte boundary anyway, might as well
03300  *  use the memory).
03301  */
03302 static void
03303 MD_resize_field_arrays (MD_Section * section, int max_index)
03304 {
03305   MD_Field_Decl **new_decl_array, **old_decl_array;
03306   MD_Symbol *symbol;
03307   MD_Entry *entry;
03308   MD_Field **new_field_array, **old_field_array;
03309   int max_field_index, new_array_size, i;
03310 
03311   /* Increase size by first rounding up to the nearest odd number,
03312    * then adding 3 to it so that the new_array_size is always even
03313    * and has space for another 2 or 3 field declarations.
03314    */
03315   new_array_size = (max_index | 1) + 3;
03316 
03317   /* Sanity check */
03318   if (new_array_size <= section->field_array_size)
03319     {
03320       MD_punt (section->md,
03321                "MD_resize_field_arrays: new_array_size (%i) "
03322                "must be > current size (%i)",
03323                new_array_size, section->field_array_size);
03324     }
03325 
03326   /* Get the max_field_index for ease of use */
03327   max_field_index = section->max_field_index;
03328 
03329   /* 
03330    * Resize the field declaration array 
03331    */
03332 
03333   /* Create new field decl array */
03334   new_decl_array = (MD_Field_Decl **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Field_Decl *) *
03335                                               new_array_size);
03336   if (new_decl_array == NULL)
03337     {
03338       MD_punt (section->md,
03339                "MD_resize_field_arrays: Out of memory (size %i)",
03340                new_array_size);
03341     }
03342 
03343   /* Get pointer to old array */
03344   old_decl_array = section->field_decl;
03345 
03346   /* Copy over pointers from existing array 
03347    * (Assumes max_field_index is -1 if old array is NULL).
03348    */
03349   for (i = 0; i <= max_field_index; i++)
03350     new_decl_array[i] = old_decl_array[i];
03351 
03352   /* Initialize remaining pointers to NULL */
03353   for (i = max_field_index + 1; i < new_array_size; i++)
03354     new_decl_array[i] = NULL;
03355 
03356   /* Free old array, if not NULL */
03357   if (old_decl_array != NULL)
03358     free (old_decl_array);
03359 
03360   /* Install new field declaration array */
03361   section->field_decl = new_decl_array;
03362   section->field_array_size = new_array_size;
03363 
03364   /*
03365    * Resize all the field array in all the section's entries
03366    */
03367 
03368   /* Process each entry in the section */
03369   for (symbol = section->entry_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
03370        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
03371     {
03372       /* Get a pointer to this entry */
03373       entry = (MD_Entry *) symbol->data;
03374 
03375       /* Create new field array for this entry */
03376       new_field_array = (MD_Field **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Field *) *
03377                                               new_array_size);
03378       if (new_field_array == NULL)
03379         {
03380           MD_punt (section->md,
03381                    "MD_resize_field_arrays: Out of memory (size %i)",
03382                    new_array_size);
03383         }
03384 
03385       /* Get pointer to old array for ease of use */
03386       old_field_array = entry->field;
03387 
03388       /* Copy over pointers from existing array 
03389        * (Assumes max_field_index is -1 if old array is NULL).
03390        */
03391       for (i = 0; i <= max_field_index; i++)
03392         new_field_array[i] = old_field_array[i];
03393 
03394       /* Initialize remaining pointers to NULL */
03395       for (i = max_field_index + 1; i < new_array_size; i++)
03396         new_field_array[i] = NULL;
03397 
03398       /* Free old array, if not NULL */
03399       if (old_field_array != NULL)
03400         free (old_field_array);
03401 
03402       /* Install new field array into entry */
03403       entry->field = new_field_array;
03404     }
03405 }
03406 
03407 /*
03408  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_num_field_decls()!
03409  * This is the function version of the macro MD_num_field_decls().
03410  * 
03411  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macros.
03412  */
03413 int
03414 _MD_num_field_decls (MD_Section * section)
03415 {
03416   /* Return number of declarations found in the section's field decl table */
03417   return (section->field_decl_table->symbol_count);
03418 }
03419 
03420 /*
03421  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_max_field_index()!
03422  * This is the function version of the macro MD_max_field_index().
03423  * 
03424  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macros.
03425  */
03426 int
03427 _MD_max_field_index (MD_Section * section)
03428 {
03429   /* Return the index of the max declared field */
03430   return (section->max_field_index);
03431 }
03432 
03433 /*
03434  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_find_field_decl()!
03435  * This is the function version of the macro MD_find_field_decl().
03436  * 
03437  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macros.
03438  */
03439 MD_Field_Decl *
03440 _MD_find_field_decl (MD_Section * section, char *name)
03441 {
03442   /* Find field_decl in section table, return data cast as MD_Field_Decl */
03443   return ((MD_Field_Decl *) _MD_find_symbol_data (section->field_decl_table,
03444                                                   name));
03445 }
03446 
03447 /*
03448  * Returns a pointer to the first field declaration in the section or
03449  * NULL if no fields are declared for the section.
03450  */
03451 MD_Field_Decl *
03452 MD_first_field_decl (MD_Section * section)
03453 {
03454   MD_Symbol *symbol;
03455 
03456   symbol = section->field_decl_table->head_symbol;
03457 
03458   if (symbol != NULL)
03459     return ((MD_Field_Decl *) symbol->data);
03460   else
03461     return (NULL);
03462 }
03463 
03464 /*
03465  * Returns a pointer to the last field declaration in the section or
03466  * NULL if no fields are declared for the section.
03467  */
03468 MD_Field_Decl *
03469 MD_last_field_decl (MD_Section * section)
03470 {
03471   MD_Symbol *symbol;
03472 
03473   symbol = section->field_decl_table->tail_symbol;
03474 
03475   if (symbol != NULL)
03476     return ((MD_Field_Decl *) symbol->data);
03477   else
03478     return (NULL);
03479 }
03480 
03481 /* 
03482  * Returns a pointer to the next field declaration in the section or
03483  * NULL if passed a pointer to the last field declaration in the section
03484  */
03485 MD_Field_Decl *
03486 MD_next_field_decl (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl)
03487 {
03488   MD_Symbol *symbol;
03489 
03490   symbol = field_decl->symbol->next_symbol;
03491 
03492   if (symbol != NULL)
03493     return ((MD_Field_Decl *) symbol->data);
03494   else
03495     return (NULL);
03496 }
03497 
03498 /* 
03499  * Returns a pointer to the previous field declaration in the section or
03500  * NULL if passed a pointer to the first field declaration in the section
03501  */
03502 MD_Field_Decl *
03503 MD_prev_field_decl (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl)
03504 {
03505   MD_Symbol *symbol;
03506 
03507   symbol = field_decl->symbol->prev_symbol;
03508 
03509   if (symbol != NULL)
03510     return ((MD_Field_Decl *) symbol->data);
03511   else
03512     return (NULL);
03513 }
03514 
03515 
03516 
03517 /* 
03518  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_delete_field_decl()!
03519  * Frees the memory associated with a field declaration.
03520  * Used by MD_delete_field_decl macro and MD_delete_section.
03521  * 
03522  * Assumes field declaration has already been removed from the 
03523  * section's field_decl_table.
03524  * 
03525  * Does not free this field's data in all the section's entries.
03526  * This is done externally by _MD_free_section() and MD_delete_field_decl().
03527  */
03528 void
03529 _MD_free_field_decl (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl)
03530 {
03531   char *name;
03532   MD_Element_Req **require, *element_req;
03533   int i, max_require_index;
03534 
03535   /* Free name last (for error messages) */
03536   name = field_decl->name;
03537 
03538   /* Remove field_decl from section's field_decl array */
03539   field_decl->section->field_decl[field_decl->field_index] = NULL;
03540 
03541   /* Get the require array and max index for ease of use */
03542   require = field_decl->require;
03543   max_require_index = field_decl->max_require_index;
03544 
03545   /* Delete element requirements in the require array
03546    * (Assumes max_require_index is -1 if require array is NULL) */
03547   for (i = 0; i <= max_require_index; i++)
03548     {
03549       /* Get element to free */
03550       element_req = require[i];
03551 
03552       /* Free element_req description */
03553       free (element_req->desc);
03554 
03555       /* If a link, free link array */
03556       if (element_req->type == MD_LINK)
03557         free (element_req->link);
03558 
03559       /* Free element structure using L_free */
03560       L_free (MD_Element_Req_pool, element_req);
03561     }
03562 
03563   /* Free the require array (if exists) */
03564   if (require != NULL)
03565     free (require);
03566 
03567   /* Free the field declaration structure */
03568   L_free (MD_Field_Decl_pool, field_decl);
03569 
03570   /* Free the field_decl's name */
03571   free (name);
03572 }
03573 
03574 /* Deletes a field declaration and deletes all the data for this
03575  * field from all the entries in the section.
03576  */
03577 void
03578 MD_delete_field_decl (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl)
03579 {
03580   MD_Section *section;
03581   MD_Symbol *symbol;
03582   MD_Entry *entry;
03583   MD_Field *field;
03584   int field_index;
03585 
03586   /* Get the section for ease of use */
03587   section = field_decl->section;
03588 
03589   /* The the index of this field for ease of use */
03590   field_index = field_decl->field_index;
03591 
03592   /* Scan every entry in section and delete any info associated
03593    * with this name.  Must delete before freeing field decl
03594    * becuase MD_delete_field using field_decl info.
03595    */
03596   for (symbol = section->entry_table->head_symbol; symbol != NULL;
03597        symbol = symbol->next_symbol)
03598     {
03599       /* Get the entry for ease of use */
03600       entry = (MD_Entry *) symbol->data;
03601 
03602       /* Get the field pointer from the field array */
03603       field = entry->field[field_index];
03604 
03605       if (field != NULL)
03606         {
03607           MD_delete_field (field);
03608         }
03609     }
03610 
03611   /* Delete symbol and structure memory */
03612   MD_delete_symbol (field_decl->symbol,
03613                     (void (*)(void *)) _MD_free_field_decl);
03614 }
03615 
03616 /* Prints out a textual representation of a field declaration.
03617  * Called by MD_print_section().
03618  */
03619 void
03620 MD_print_field_decl (FILE * out, MD_Field_Decl * field_decl, int page_width)
03621 {
03622   MD_Element_Req **require_array, *require;
03623   MD_FIELD_TYPE type;
03624   char *field_name;
03625   int decl_len;
03626   int max_require_index, require_index, first_requirement;
03627   int require_indent, print_column, i;
03628 
03629   /* Get various values into local variables for ease of use */
03630   type = field_decl->type;
03631   require_array = field_decl->require;
03632   max_require_index = field_decl->max_require_index;
03633   field_name = field_decl->name;
03634 
03635   /* Print out the type of field this is */
03636   if (type == MD_REQUIRED_FIELD)
03637     {
03638       fprintf (out, "  REQUIRED ");
03639     }
03640   else if (type == MD_OPTIONAL_FIELD)
03641     {
03642       fprintf (out, "  OPTIONAL ");
03643     }
03644   else
03645     {
03646       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
03647                "MD_print_field_decl: Unknown field decl type '%i'", type);
03648     }
03649 
03650   /* Print out field name and openning '(' */
03651   fprintf (out, "%s(", field_name);
03652 
03653   /* Get the indentation to line up after openning '(' */
03654   require_indent = strlen (field_name) + 12;
03655 
03656   /* Get the current column position */
03657   print_column = require_indent;
03658 
03659   /* Mark that we are about to process the first requirement */
03660   first_requirement = 1;
03661 
03662   /* Print out the requirements for the field */
03663   for (require_index = 0; require_index <= max_require_index; require_index++)
03664     {
03665       /* Get this requirment */
03666       require = require_array[require_index];
03667 
03668       /* Get the length of the requirement declaration */
03669       decl_len = strlen (require->desc);
03670 
03671 
03672       /* 
03673        * If not first requirement, see if can fit this requirement on
03674        * this line or if need to goto next line.
03675        * (Always print the first requirement on each line)
03676        */
03677       if (!first_requirement)
03678         {
03679           /* See if we will exceed page width if this decl is printed out,
03680            * leaving 3 spaces for trailing '); '
03681            */
03682           if ((print_column + decl_len) >= (page_width - 3))
03683             {
03684               /* Goto next line */
03685               putc ('\n', out);
03686 
03687               /* Indent to line of with the declaration above */
03688               for (i = 0; i < require_indent; i++)
03689                 putc (' ', out);
03690 
03691               /* Reset print_column */
03692               print_column = require_indent;
03693             }
03694 
03695           /* Otherwise, just print space after last requirment */
03696           else
03697             {
03698               putc (' ', out);
03699               print_column++;
03700             }
03701         }
03702 
03703       /* Otherwise, mark that the next requirement will not be first 
03704        * requirement on this line.
03705        */
03706       else
03707         {
03708           first_requirement = 0;
03709         }
03710 
03711       /* Update print_column */
03712       print_column += decl_len;
03713 
03714       /* Print out description of requirement */
03715       fprintf (out, "%s", require->desc);
03716     }
03717 
03718   /* Closing out field declaration */
03719   fprintf (out, ");\n");
03720 }
03721 
03722 /* Creates a new element requirement in the field declaration at
03723  * at the specified element index.
03724  * 
03725  * These element requirements must in order, starting from index 0.
03726  * For example, a requirment at index 1 cannot be created until
03727  * the requirement for index 0 is created.
03728  * 
03729  * These element requirements specify what type of data must go at
03730  * that index and that there must be data at that index.
03731  * These two properties are designed to reduce the error checking the 
03732  * md user must do.
03733  *
03734  * The name of the calling routine is passed in for error messages.
03735  * 
03736  * Returns a pointer to the new element_req structure 
03737  */
03738 static MD_Element_Req *
03739 MD_new_element_req (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl, int index, char *caller_name)
03740 {
03741   MD_Element_Req *element_req, **old_require_array, **new_require_array;
03742   int i, new_array_size, max_require_index;
03743 
03744   /* Get max_require_index for ease of use */
03745   max_require_index = field_decl->max_require_index;
03746 
03747   /* Check that the index is valid, must be defining
03748    * the requirement just past the current requirements.
03749    */
03750   if (index != (max_require_index + 1))
03751     {
03752       /* Give error message for redefinition */
03753       if (index <= max_require_index)
03754         {
03755           MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
03756                    "%s(%s->*->%s[%i]):\n  Element %i already required "
03757                    "to be '%s'!", caller_name, field_decl->section->name,
03758                    field_decl->name, index, index,
03759                    field_decl->require[index]->desc);
03760         }
03761       /* Otherwise, give error message for non-sequential definition */
03762       else
03763         {
03764           MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
03765                    "%s(%s->*->%s[%i]):\n  Specify requirements for "
03766                    "elements before %i first!",
03767                    caller_name, field_decl->section->name, field_decl->name,
03768                    index, index);
03769         }
03770     }
03771 
03772   /* Check if trying to set a requirement past a kleene_starred
03773    * requirement.
03774    */
03775   if (field_decl->kleene_starred_req != NULL)
03776     {
03777       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
03778                "%s(%s->*->%s[%i]):\n  Cannot specify requirements after a "
03779                "kleene starred requirement!",
03780                caller_name, field_decl->section->name, field_decl->name,
03781                index);
03782     }
03783 
03784   /* Resize require array if necessary */
03785   if (index >= field_decl->require_array_size)
03786     {
03787       /* Increase size by first rounding up to the nearest odd number,
03788        * then adding 3 to it so that the new_require_array_size is always 
03789        * even and has space for another 2 or 3 requirements.
03790        */
03791       new_array_size = (index | 1) + 3;
03792 
03793       /* Allocate new array */
03794       new_require_array =
03795         (MD_Element_Req **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Element_Req *) *
03796                                     new_array_size);
03797       if (new_require_array == NULL)
03798         {
03799           MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
03800                    "Out of memory resizing require array (size %i).",
03801                    new_array_size);
03802         }
03803 
03804       /* Get old array ease of use */
03805       old_require_array = field_decl->require;
03806 
03807       /* Copy over pointers from existing array
03808        * (Assumes max_require_index is -1 if old array is NULL).
03809        */
03810       for (i = 0; i <= max_require_index; i++)
03811         new_require_array[i] = old_require_array[i];
03812 
03813       /* Initialize remaining pointers to NULL */
03814       for (i = max_require_index + 1; i < new_array_size; i++)
03815         new_require_array[i] = NULL;
03816 
03817       /* Free old array, if not NULL */
03818       if (old_require_array != NULL)
03819         free (old_require_array);
03820 
03821       /* Install new require array */
03822       field_decl->require = new_require_array;
03823       field_decl->require_array_size = new_array_size;
03824     }
03825 
03826   /* Allocate element_req structure */
03827   element_req = (MD_Element_Req *) L_alloc (MD_Element_Req_pool);
03828 
03829   /* Initialize fields other than type and desc which should
03830    * always set by caller.
03831    */
03832   element_req->field_decl = field_decl;
03833   element_req->require_index = index;
03834   element_req->kleene_starred = 0;      /* Initially not kleene_starred */
03835   element_req->link = NULL;
03836   element_req->link_array_size = 0;
03837 
03838   /* Place in require structure at correct index */
03839   field_decl->require[index] = element_req;
03840 
03841   /* Update max index (checking at top of function requires it to
03842    * be the new max)
03843    */
03844   field_decl->max_require_index = index;
03845 
03846   /* Return new structure */
03847   return (element_req);
03848 }
03849 
03850 /* Specifies that an int element is required at the index specified.
03851  * 
03852  * See description of MD_new_element_req() for restrictions on index
03853  * and the properties of element requirements.
03854  */
03855 void
03856 MD_require_int (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl, int element_index)
03857 {
03858   MD_Element_Req *element_req;
03859 
03860   /* Check element_index for validity, allocates element_req structure,
03861    * resize require array (if necessary) and places element_req in
03862    * the require array. 
03863    * All fields except type and desc initialized to correct values.
03864    *
03865    * Pass this function's name for error messages.
03866    */
03867   element_req = MD_new_element_req (field_decl, element_index,
03868                                     "MD_require_int");
03869 
03870   /* Set element requirement to INT and set the description for error 
03871    * messages.
03872    */
03873   element_req->type = MD_INT;
03874   element_req->desc = MD_strdup ("INT");
03875 }
03876 
03877 /* Specifies that an double element is required at the index specified.
03878  * 
03879  * See description of MD_new_element_req() for restrictions on index
03880  * and the properties of element requirements.
03881  */
03882 void
03883 MD_require_double (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl, int element_index)
03884 {

03887   /* Check element_index for validity, allocates element_req structure,
03888    * resize require array (if necessary) and places element_req in
03889    * the require array. 
03890    * All fields except type and desc initialized to correct values.
03891    *
03892    * Pass this function's name for error messages.
03893    */
03894   element_req = MD_new_element_req (field_decl, element_index,
03895                                     "MD_require_double");
03896 
03897   /* Set element requirement to DOUBLE and set the description for error 
03898    * messages.
03899    */
03900   element_req->type = MD_DOUBLE;
03901   element_req->desc = MD_strdup ("DOUBLE");
03902 }

03957 
03958 /* Specifies that a link (to a single target) element is required at the index
03959  * specified.  Use MD_require_multi_target_link() if multiple targets
03960  * are desired.
03961  * 
03962  * See description of MD_new_element_req() for restrictions on index
03963  * and the properties of element requirements.
03964  */
03965 void
03966 MD_require_link (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl, int element_index,
03967                  MD_Section * section)
03968 {
03969   MD_Element_Req *element_req;
03970   MD_Section **link;
03971   int desc_length;
03972   char *desc;
03973 
03974 
03975   /* Check element_index for validity, allocates element_req structure,
03976    * resize require array (if necessary) and places element_req in
03977    * the require array. 
03978    * All fields except type and desc initialized to correct values.
03979    *
03980    * Pass this function's name for error messages.
03981    */
03982   element_req = MD_new_element_req (field_decl, element_index,
03983                                     "MD_require_link");
03984 
03985 
03986   /* Allocate link array for section array */
03987   link = (MD_Section **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Section *));
03988   if (link == NULL)
03989     {
03990       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
03991                "Out of memory allocating link array (size 1)");
03992     }
03993 
03994   /* Initialize link array */
03995   link[0] = section;
03996 
03997   /* Calculate the length of the description field */
03998   desc_length = strlen (section->name) + strlen ("LINK()") + 1;
03999 
04000   /* Malloc description buffer */
04001   desc = (char *) malloc (sizeof (char) * desc_length);
04002   if (desc == NULL)
04003     {
04004       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04005                "Out of memory allocating link desc (size %i)", desc_length);
04006     }
04007 
04008   /* Sanity check, mark where we expect terminator */
04009   desc[desc_length - 1] = 1;
04010 
04011   /* Create description */
04012   sprintf (desc, "LINK(%s)", section->name);
04013 
04014   /* Sanity check, make sure terminator is where we expect it */
04015   if (desc[desc_length - 1] != 0)
04016     {
04017       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04018                "link->desc incorrect length (%i)", desc_length);
04019     }
04020 
04021   /* Set element requirement to LINK and set the description for error 
04022    * messages.
04023    */
04024   element_req->type = MD_LINK;
04025   element_req->desc = desc;
04026   element_req->link = link;
04027   element_req->link_array_size = 1;
04028 }
04029 
04030 /* Specifies that an multi-target link element is required at the index
04031  * specified.  
04032  * 
04033  * See description of MD_new_element_req() for restrictions on index
04034  * and the properties of element requirements.
04035  */
04036 void
04037 MD_require_multi_target_link (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl,
04038                               int element_index, int section_array_size,
04039                               MD_Section ** section_array)
04040 {
04041   MD_Element_Req *element_req;
04042   MD_Section **link, *section;
04043   int desc_length;
04044   char *desc, *desc_ptr, *name_ptr;
04045   int i;
04046 
04047 
04048   /* Check element_index for validity, allocates element_req structure,
04049    * resize require array (if necessary) and places element_req in
04050    * the require array. 
04051    * All fields except type and desc initialized to correct values.
04052    *
04053    * Pass this function's name for error messages.
04054    */
04055   element_req = MD_new_element_req (field_decl, element_index,
04056                                     "MD_require_multi_target_link");
04057 
04058   /* Check array size passed */
04059   if (section_array_size <= 0)
04060     {
04061       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04062                "MD_require_multi_target_link: invalid array size (%i).",
04063                section_array_size);
04064     }
04065 
04066   /* Allocate link array for section array */
04067   link = (MD_Section **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Section *) * section_array_size);
04068   if (link == NULL)
04069     {
04070       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04071                "Out of memory allocating link array (size %i)",
04072                section_array_size);
04073     }
04074 
04075   /* Initialize link array */
04076   desc_length = 0;
04077   for (i = 0; i < section_array_size; i++)
04078     {
04079       section = section_array[i];
04080       link[i] = section;
04081 
04082       /* Sum the length of all the section names */
04083       desc_length += strlen (section->name);
04084     }
04085 
04086   /* Add in the length of the wrapping string */
04087   desc_length += strlen ("LINK()");
04088 
04089   /* Add in the space for '|' and for terminator */
04090   desc_length += section_array_size;
04091 
04092   /* Malloc description buffer */
04093   desc = (char *) malloc (sizeof (char) * desc_length);
04094   if (desc == NULL)
04095     MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04096              "Out of memory allocating link desc (size %i)", desc_length);
04097 
04098   /* Sanity check, mark where we expect terminator */
04099   desc[desc_length - 1] = 1;
04100 
04101   /* Create description */
04102   strcpy (desc, "LINK(");
04103   desc_ptr = &desc[5];
04104 
04105   for (i = 0; i < section_array_size; i++)
04106     {
04107       /* Copy name to description */
04108       for (name_ptr = link[i]->name; *name_ptr != 0; name_ptr++)
04109         {
04110           *desc_ptr = *name_ptr;
04111           desc_ptr++;
04112         }
04113       /* Add '|' between names */
04114       if ((i + 1) < section_array_size)
04115         {
04116           *desc_ptr = '|';
04117           desc_ptr++;
04118         }
04119     }
04120 
04121   /* Add ending ')' and terminator */
04122   *desc_ptr = ')';
04123   desc_ptr++;
04124   *desc_ptr = 0;
04125 
04126   /* Sanity check, make sure terminator is where we expect it */
04127   if (desc[desc_length - 1] != 0)
04128     {
04129       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04130                "link->desc incorrect length (%i)", desc_length);
04131     }
04132 
04133   /* Set element requirement to LINK and set the description for error 
04134    * messages.
04135    */
04136   element_req->type = MD_LINK;
04137   element_req->desc = desc;
04138   element_req->link = link;
04139   element_req->link_array_size = section_array_size;
04140 }
04141 
04142 
04143 /* Specifies that the requirement at the index speicifed should be treated
04144  * as a kleene starred requirement (0 or more required).
04145  *
04146  * Only the last requirement may be kleene starred.
04147  */
04148 void
04149 MD_kleene_star_requirement (MD_Field_Decl * field_decl, int element_index)
04150 {
04151   MD_Element_Req *element_req;
04152   char *new_desc;
04153   int max_require_index;
04154 
04155   max_require_index = field_decl->max_require_index;
04156 
04157   /* Make sure that the element index is in range */
04158   if ((element_index < 0) || (element_index > max_require_index))
04159     {
04160       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04161                "MD_kleene_star_requirement(%s->*->%s[%i]:\n  Invalid element "
04162                "index %i (the max valid index is %i).",
04163                field_decl->section->name, field_decl->name,
04164                element_index, element_index, max_require_index);
04165     }
04166 
04167   /* Must be specifying the last requirement */
04168   if (element_index != max_require_index)
04169     {
04170       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04171                "MD_kleene_star_requirement(%s->*->%s[%i]:\n  Only the last "
04172                "requirment (%i) may be kleene starred.",
04173                field_decl->section->name, field_decl->name,
04174                element_index, max_require_index);
04175     }
04176 
04177   /* Get the requirement that we want to kleene star */
04178   element_req = field_decl->require[element_index];
04179 
04180   /* Prevent from being called twice (to aid debugging) */
04181   if (element_req->kleene_starred)
04182     {
04183       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04184                "MD_kleene_star_requirement(%s->*->%s[%i]:\n  Requirement "
04185                "already kleene starred.",
04186                field_decl->section->name, field_decl->name, element_index);
04187 
04188     }
04189 
04190   /* Sanity check, something else better not be marked kleene_starred */
04191   if (field_decl->kleene_starred_req != NULL)
04192     {
04193       MD_punt (field_decl->section->md,
04194                "MD_kleene_star_requirement(%s->*->%s[%i]:\n  Algorithm error, "
04195                "%i marked kleene starred... why?.",
04196                field_decl->section->name, field_decl->name,
04197                element_index, field_decl->kleene_starred_req->require_index);
04198     }
04199 
04200   /* Mark element as kleene starred and point field decl at it */
04201   element_req->kleene_starred = 1;
04202   field_decl->kleene_starred_req = element_req;
04203 
04204   /* Change requirement description to have extra star added */
04205   new_desc = MD_concat_strings (element_req->desc, "*");
04206 
04207   /* Free old desc */
04208   free (element_req->desc);
04209 
04210   /* Point to new description */
04211   element_req->desc = new_desc;
04212 }
04213 
04214 /* Creates a new field for the entry of type decl with an initial
04215  * size suitable for the specified number of elements.  The field
04216  * automatically resizes (upward) when appropriate, so 0 elements
04217  * may be specified.
04218  */
04219 MD_Field *
04220 MD_new_field (MD_Entry * entry, MD_Field_Decl * decl, int num_elements)
04221 {
04222   MD_Field *field, **field_slot;
04223 
04224   /* Sanity check, make sure everything is initialized properly */
04225   if (MD_Field_pool == NULL)
04226     {
04227       MD_punt (NULL, "MD routines not initialized (call MD_new_md() first)!");
04228     }
04229   field = (MD_Field *) L_alloc (MD_Field_pool);
04230 
04231   /* Initialize fields */
04232   field->entry = entry;
04233   field->decl = decl;
04234   field->max_element_index = -1;        /* No elements specified */
04235 
04236   /* Get place in entry's field array to place field */
04237   field_slot = &entry->field[decl->field_index];
04238 
04239   /* Make sure this field has not already been created for this entry */
04240   if (*field_slot != NULL)
04241     {
04242       MD_punt (entry->section->md,
04243                "%s, entry %s: Cannot create field '%s', already exists!",
04244                entry->section->name, entry->name, decl->name);
04245     }
04246 
04247   /* Place in field in the proper slot in the entry's field array */
04248   *field_slot = field;
04249 
04250   /* Punt if invalid num_elements passed */
04251   if (num_elements < 0)
04252     {
04253       MD_punt (entry->section->md,
04254                "%s, entry %s, creating field %i: "
04255                "num_elements (%i) must be >= 0",
04256                entry->section->name, entry->name, decl->name, num_elements);
04257     }
04258 
04259   /* Initialize to no array allocated */
04260   field->element = NULL;
04261   field->element_array_size = 0;
04262 
04263   /* Create array of specified size, unless 0 */
04264   if (num_elements > 0)
04265     {
04266       MD_resize_element_array (field, num_elements - 1);
04267     }
04268 
04269   return (field);
04270 }
04271 
04272 /* Increases the size of a field's element array . */
04273 static void
04274 MD_resize_element_array (MD_Field * field, int max_index)
04275 {
04276   MD_Element **old_array, **new_array;
04277   int new_size;
04278   int i;
04279 
04280   /* Increase size so that it is increased to an even multiple of four.
04281    * Helps reduce overhead of adding multiple elements.
04282    * Max element is 0 based, so need to add one to size anyways!
04283    */
04284   new_size = (max_index | 3) + 1;
04285 
04286   /* Sanity check */
04287   if (new_size <= field->element_array_size)
04288     {
04289       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
04290                "MD_resize_element_array: new_size (%i) "
04291                "must be > current size (%i)",
04292                new_size, field->element_array_size);
04293     }
04294 
04295   /* Create new element array */
04296   new_array = (MD_Element **) malloc (sizeof (MD_Element *) * new_size);
04297   if (new_array == NULL)
04298     {
04299       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
04300                "MD_resize_element_array: Out of memory");
04301     }
04302 
04303   /* Get pointer to old array */
04304   old_array = field->element;
04305 
04306   /* Copy over pointers from existing array 
04307    * (Assumes max_element_index is -1 if old array is NULL).
04308    */
04309   for (i = field->max_element_index; i >= 0; i--)
04310     new_array[i] = old_array[i];
04311 
04312   /* Initialize remaining pointers to NULL */
04313   for (i = field->max_element_index + 1; i < new_size; i++)
04314     new_array[i] = NULL;
04315 
04316   /* Free old array, if not NULL */
04317   if (old_array != NULL)
04318     free (old_array);
04319 
04320   /* Install new array */
04321   field->element = new_array;
04322   field->element_array_size = new_size;
04323 }
04324 
04325 /* DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_find_field()!
04326  * This is the function version of MD_find_field()
04327  * 
04328  * Does a little more error check than the macro.
04329  */
04330 MD_Field *
04331 _MD_find_field (MD_Entry * entry, MD_Field_Decl * field_decl)
04332 {
04333   MD_Field *field;
04334 
04335   /* Make sure the entry and field_decl are for the same section */
04336   if (entry->section != field_decl->section)
04337     {
04338       MD_punt (entry->section->md,
04339                "MD_find_field: entry (%s) from section %s and field "
04340                "decl (%s) from %s!",
04341                entry->name, entry->section->name, field_decl->name,
04342                field_decl->section->name);
04343     }
04344 
04345   /* Get the field from the entry (may be NULL) */
04346   field = entry->field[field_decl->field_index];
04347 
04348   return (field);
04349 }
04350 
04351 /* Delete a field from an entry */
04352 void
04353 MD_delete_field (MD_Field * field)
04354 {
04355   MD_Element *element, **element_array;
04356   int index, max_element_index;
04357 
04358   /* Get max_element_index and the element array for ease of use */
04359   max_element_index = field->max_element_index;
04360   element_array = field->element;
04361 
04362   /* Free all the element's allocated. 
04363    * (Assumes max_element_index == -1 if element_array is NULL
04364    */
04365   for (index = 0; index <= max_element_index; index++)
04366     {
04367       /* Get the element (may be NULL) */
04368       element = element_array[index];
04369 
04370       /* Free element if non-NULL */
04371       if (element != NULL)
04372         {
04373           /* If element is a string, free string */
04374           if (element->type == MD_STRING)
04375             free (element->value.s);
04376 
04377           /* if element is a block, free block */
04378           else if (element->type == MD_BLOCK)
04379             {
04380               if (element->value.b.ptr != NULL)
04381                 free (element->value.b.ptr);
04382             }
04383 
04384           L_free (MD_Element_pool, element);
04385         }
04386     }
04387 
04388   /* Free element array (if exists) */
04389   if (element_array != NULL)
04390     free (element_array);
04391 
04392   /* Remove field pointer from entry field array */
04393   field->entry->field[field->decl->field_index] = NULL;
04394 
04395   /* Free field structure */
04396   L_free (MD_Field_pool, field);
04397 }
04398 
04399 /*
04400  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_check_field()!
04401  * This function checks the elements in the specified field.
04402  * Used by the MD_check_field() macro and _MD_check_entry().
04403  * 
04404  * Returns the number of elements with incorrect type (0 if all ok).
04405  * 
04406  * If out is non-NULL, warning messages for each incorrect type will
04407  * be printed to out.
04408  *
04409  * The caller_name is used in the warning messages to identify the
04410  * routine/macro that started the checking process (MD_check_md, 
04411  * MD_check_section, MD_check_entry, or MD_check_field).
04412  */
04413 int
04414 _MD_check_field (FILE * out, MD_Field * field, char *caller_name)
04415 {
04416   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
04417   MD_Element_Req **require_array, *requirement, *kleene_starred_req;
04418   MD_Element **element_array, *element;
04419   MD_Section *section, **link_array, *target_section;
04420   MD_Entry *entry;
04421   int max_element_index, max_require_index;
04422   int max_non_kleene_index, max_assigned_index, max_check_index;
04423   int link_array_size, valid_link;
04424   int i, j;
04425   int error_count;
04426 
04427   /* Initialize the error count */
04428   error_count = 0;
04429 
04430   /* Get the various pointers into local variables for ease of use */
04431   field_decl = field->decl;
04432   element_array = field->element;
04433   max_element_index = field->max_element_index;
04434   require_array = field_decl->require;
04435   max_require_index = field_decl->max_require_index;
04436   kleene_starred_req = field_decl->kleene_starred_req;
04437   entry = field->entry;
04438   section = entry->section;
04439 
04440   /* Make max_assigned_index point at the last element set to a value */
04441   max_assigned_index = max_element_index;
04442   while ((max_assigned_index >= 0) &&
04443          (element_array[max_assigned_index] == NULL))
04444     max_assigned_index--;
04445 
04446   /* Get the index of the last non-kleene starred requirement */
04447   if (kleene_starred_req != NULL)
04448     max_non_kleene_index = max_require_index - 1;
04449   else
04450     max_non_kleene_index = max_require_index;
04451 
04452   /* Get the last index we need to check 
04453    * (check to maximum non-kleene starred requirement or to last
04454    * assigned index.)
04455    */
04456   if (max_assigned_index > max_non_kleene_index)
04457     max_check_index = max_assigned_index;
04458   else
04459     max_check_index = max_non_kleene_index;
04460 
04461 
04462   /* Scan all the elements that require checking. */
04463   for (i = 0; (i <= max_check_index); i++)
04464     {
04465       if (i <= max_assigned_index)
04466         element = element_array[i];
04467       else
04468         element = NULL;
04469 
04470       if (i <= max_non_kleene_index)
04471         requirement = require_array[i];
04472       else
04473         requirement = kleene_starred_req;
04474 
04475       /* Don't print out error message if both element and requirement
04476        * are NULL.
04477        */
04478       if ((element == NULL) && (requirement == NULL))
04479         continue;
04480 
04481       /* Handle NULL elements */
04482       if (element == NULL)
04483         {
04484           error_count++;
04485           if (out != NULL)
04486             {
04487               MD_warn (out,
04488                        "%s(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Warning, %s required not NULL.",
04489                        caller_name, section->name, entry->name,
04490                        field_decl->name, i, requirement->desc);
04491             }
04492         }
04493 
04494       /* Handle NULL requirement */
04495       else if (requirement == NULL)
04496         {
04497           error_count++;
04498           if (out != NULL)
04499             {
04500               MD_warn (out,
04501                        "%s(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Warning, NULL required not %s.",
04502                        caller_name, section->name, entry->name,
04503                        field_decl->name, i, MD_type_name[element->type]);
04504             }
04505         }
04506 
04507       else if (element->type != requirement->type)
04508         {
04509           error_count++;
04510           if (out != NULL)
04511             {
04512               MD_warn (out,
04513                        "%s(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Warning, %s required not %s.",
04514                        caller_name, section->name, entry->name,
04515                        field_decl->name, i, requirement->desc,
04516                        MD_type_name[element->type]);
04517             }
04518         }
04519       else if (element->type == MD_LINK)
04520         {
04521           link_array = requirement->link;
04522           link_array_size = requirement->link_array_size;
04523           target_section = element->value.l->section;
04524           valid_link = 0;
04525 
04526           for (j = 0; j < link_array_size; j++)
04527             {
04528               if (link_array[j] == target_section)
04529                 {
04530                   valid_link = 1;
04531                   break;
04532                 }
04533             }
04534 
04535           if (!valid_link)
04536             {
04537               error_count++;
04538               if (out != NULL)
04539                 {
04540                   MD_warn (out,
04541                            "%s(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Warning, %s required "
04542                            "not link to %s->%s.",
04543                            caller_name, section->name, entry->name,
04544                            field_decl->name, i, requirement->desc,
04545                            target_section->name, element->value.l->name);
04546                 }
04547             }
04548         }
04549     }
04550 
04551   /* Return count of error encountered */
04552   return (error_count);
04553 }
04554 
04555 
04556 /* Used by the MD_set_xxx routines to do type checking */
04557 static int
04558 MD_check_setting (FILE * out, MD_Field * field, int index, char *caller_name)
04559 {
04560   MD_Field_Decl *field_decl;
04561   MD_Element_Req *requirement;
04562   MD_Element *element;
04563   MD_Section **link_array, *target_section;
04564   int link_array_size, valid_link;
04565   int j;
04566 
04567   /* Get the various pointers into local variables for ease of use */
04568   field_decl = field->decl;
04569 
04570   if (index <= field->max_element_index)
04571     element = field->element[index];
04572   else
04573     element = NULL;
04574 
04575   if (index <= field_decl->max_require_index)
04576     requirement = field_decl->require[index];
04577   else
04578     requirement = field_decl->kleene_starred_req;
04579 
04580   /* Don't print out error message if both element and requirement
04581    * are NULL.
04582    */
04583   if ((element == NULL) && (requirement == NULL))
04584     {
04585       /* Return 0 to signal no errors found */
04586       return (0);
04587     }
04588 
04589   /* Handle NULL elements */
04590   if (element == NULL)
04591     {
04592       if (out != NULL)
04593         {
04594           MD_warn (out,
04595                    "%s(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Warning, %s required not NULL.",
04596                    caller_name, field->entry->section->name,
04597                    field->entry->name, field_decl->name, index,
04598                    requirement->desc);
04599         }
04600       /* Return 1 to signal 1 error found */
04601       return (1);
04602     }
04603 
04604   /* Handle NULL requirement */
04605   else if (requirement == NULL)
04606     {
04607       if (out != NULL)
04608         {
04609           MD_warn (out,
04610                    "%s(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Warning, NULL required not %s.",
04611                    caller_name, field->entry->section->name,
04612                    field->entry->name, field_decl->name, index,
04613                    MD_type_name[element->type]);
04614         }
04615       /* Return 1 to signal 1 error found */
04616       return (1);
04617     }
04618   else if (element->type != requirement->type)
04619     {
04620       if (out != NULL)
04621         {
04622           MD_warn (out,
04623                    "%s(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Warning, %s required not %s.",
04624                    caller_name, field->entry->section->name,
04625                    field->entry->name, field_decl->name, index,
04626                    requirement->desc, MD_type_name[element->type]);
04627         }
04628       /* Return 1 to signal 1 error found */
04629       return (1);
04630     }
04631   else if (element->type == MD_LINK)
04632     {
04633       link_array = requirement->link;
04634       link_array_size = requirement->link_array_size;
04635       target_section = element->value.l->section;
04636       valid_link = 0;
04637 
04638       for (j = 0; j < link_array_size; j++)
04639         {
04640           if (link_array[j] == target_section)
04641             {
04642               valid_link = 1;
04643               break;
04644             }
04645         }
04646 
04647       if (!valid_link)
04648         {
04649           if (out != NULL)
04650             {
04651               MD_warn (out,
04652                        "%s(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Warning, %s required not "
04653                        "link to %s->%s.",
04654                        caller_name, field->entry->section->name,
04655                        field->entry->name, field_decl->name, index,
04656                        requirement->desc, target_section->name,
04657                        element->value.l->name);
04658             }
04659           /* Return 1 to signal 1 error found */
04660           return (1);
04661         }
04662     }
04663 
04664   /* Return 0 to signal 0 errors found */
04665   return (0);
04666 }
04667 
04668 /*
04669  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_num_elements()!
04670  * This is the function version of the macro MD_num_elements().
04671  * 
04672  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macros.
04673  */
04674 int
04675 _MD_num_elements (MD_Field * field)
04676 {
04677   /* Return number of elements in a field (DOES count NULL elements before
04678    * the last defined element).
04679    */
04680   return (field->max_element_index + 1);
04681 }
04682 
04683 /*
04684  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY! Use macro MD_max_element_index()!
04685  * This is the function version of the macro MD_max_element_index().
04686  * 
04687  * Used to allow arguments to be checked for macros.
04688  */
04689 int
04690 _MD_max_element_index (MD_Field * field)
04691 {
04692   /* Return the index of the last defined element in the field. */
04693   return (field->max_element_index);
04694 }
04695 
04696 
04697 /*
04698  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_int()!
04699  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_int() without
04700  * type checking.
04701  *
04702  * Sets the field element at index to the int value. 
04703  */
04704 void
04705 _MD_set_int (MD_Field * field, int index, int value)
04706 {
04707   MD_Element *element;
04708 
04709   /* Detect errors, make sure index is not negative! */
04710   if (index < 0)
04711     {
04712       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
04713                "MD_set_int (%s->%s->%s[%d]): Invalid index (%d)\n",
04714                field->entry->section->name, field->entry->name,
04715                field->decl->name, index, index);
04716     }
04717 
04718   /* Detect need to increase max_element_index. */
04719   if (index > field->max_element_index)
04720     {
04721       /* Detect need to increase element array size */
04722       if (index >= field->element_array_size)
04723         {
04724           /* Increase element array size so index can be handled */
04725           MD_resize_element_array (field, index);
04726         }
04727 
04728       /* Set max_element_index to new value */
04729       field->max_element_index = index;
04730     }
04731 
04732   /* Get element */
04733   element = field->element[index];
04734 
04735   /* Create element if doesn't exist */
04736   if (element == NULL)
04737     {
04738       element = (MD_Element *) L_alloc (MD_Element_pool);
04739       field->element[index] = element;
04740     }
04741 
04742   /* Otherwise, free string memory if the existing element is a string */
04743   else if (element->type == MD_STRING)
04744     {
04745       free (element->value.s);
04746     }
04747   /* Otherwise, free block memory if the existing element is a block */
04748   else if (element->type == MD_BLOCK)
04749     {
04750       if (element->value.b.ptr != NULL)
04751         free (element->value.b.ptr);
04752     }
04753 
04754   /* Set content of element */
04755   element->field = field;
04756   element->element_index = (unsigned short) index;
04757   element->type = MD_INT;
04758   element->value.i = value;
04759 }
04760 
04761 /*
04762  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_int()!
04763  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_int() with
04764  * type checking.
04765  *
04766  * Sets the field element at index to the int value. 
04767  */
04768 void
04769 _MD_set_int_type_checking (MD_Field * field, int index, int value)
04770 {
04771   /* Call the normal set_int routine first */
04772   _MD_set_int (field, index, value);
04773 
04774   /* Call the check routine for this element */
04775   MD_check_setting (stderr, field, index, "MD_set_int");
04776 }
04777 
04778 /*
04779  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_get_int()!
04780  * This is the function version of the macro MD_get_int().
04781  *
04782  * Gets the int value of the element at the specified index.
04783  * The user must prevent this routine from being called for a NULL element.
04784  * 
04785  * Unlike the macro, this verifies element type is correct.
04786  *
04787  */
04788 int
04789 _MD_get_int (MD_Field * field, int index)
04790 {
04791   MD_Element *element;
04792 
04793   /* Get the element */
04794   element = field->element[index];
04795 
04796   /* Make sure this is an int element */
04797   if (element->type != MD_INT)
04798     {
04799       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
04800                "MD_get_int(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Accessing %s element as an INT!",
04801                field->entry->section->name,
04802                field->entry->name, field->decl->name,
04803                index, MD_type_name[(int) element->type]);
04804     }
04805 
04806   /* Return element's value */
04807   return (element->value.i);
04808 }
04809 
04810 /*
04811  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_double()!
04812  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_double() without
04813  * type checking.
04814  *
04815  * Sets the field element at index to the double value 
04816  */
04817 void
04818 _MD_set_double (MD_Field * field, int index, double value)
04819 {
04820   MD_Element *element;
04821 
04822   /* Detect errors, make sure index is not negative! */
04823   if (index < 0)
04824     {
04825       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
04826                "MD_set_double (%s->%s->%s[%d]): Invalid index (%d)\n",
04827                field->entry->section->name, field->entry->name,
04828                field->decl->name, index, index);
04829     }
04830 
04831   /* Detect need to increase max_element_index. */
04832   if (index > field->max_element_index)
04833     {
04834       /* Detect need to increase element array size */
04835       if (index >= field->element_array_size)
04836         {
04837           /* Increase element array size so index can be handled */
04838           MD_resize_element_array (field, index);
04839         }
04840 
04841       /* Set max_element_index to new value */
04842       field->max_element_index = index;
04843     }
04844 
04845   /* Get element */
04846   element = field->element[index];
04847 
04848   /* Create element if doesn't exist */
04849   if (element == NULL)
04850     {
04851       element = (MD_Element *) L_alloc (MD_Element_pool);
04852       field->element[index] = element;
04853     }
04854   /* Otherwise, free string memory if the existing element is a string */
04855   else if (element->type == MD_STRING)
04856     {
04857       free (element->value.s);
04858     }
04859   /* Otherwise, free block memory if the existing element is a block */
04860   else if (element->type == MD_BLOCK)
04861     {
04862       if (element->value.b.ptr != NULL)
04863         free (element->value.b.ptr);
04864     }
04865 
04866   /* Set content of element */
04867   element->field = field;
04868   element->element_index = (unsigned short) index;
04869   element->type = MD_DOUBLE;
04870   element->value.d = value;
04871 }
04872 
04873 /*
04874  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_double()!
04875  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_double() with
04876  * type checking.
04877  *
04878  * Sets the field element at index to the double value. 
04879  */
04880 void
04881 _MD_set_double_type_checking (MD_Field * field, int index, double value)
04882 {
04883   /* Call the normal set_double routine first */
04884   _MD_set_double (field, index, value);
04885 
04886   /* Call the check routine for this element */
04887   MD_check_setting (stderr, field, index, "MD_set_double");
04888 }
04889 
04890 /*
04891  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_get_double()!
04892  * This is the function version of the macro MD_get_double().
04893  *
04894  * Gets the double value of the element at the specified index.
04895  * The user must prevent this routine from being called for a NULL element.
04896  * 
04897  * Unlike the macro, this verifies element type is correct.
04898  *
04899  */
04900 double
04901 _MD_get_double (MD_Field * field, int index)
04902 {
04903   MD_Element *element;
04904 
04905   /* Get the element */
04906   element = field->element[index];
04907 
04908   /* Make sure this is an double element */
04909   if (element->type != MD_DOUBLE)
04910     {
04911       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
04912                "MD_get_double(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Accessing %s "
04913                "element as a DOUBLE!",
04914                field->entry->section->name,
04915                field->entry->name, field->decl->name,
04916                index, MD_type_name[(int) element->type]);
04917     }
04918 
04919   /* Return element's value */
04920   return (element->value.d);
04921 }
04922 
04923 /*
04924  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_string()!

04926  * type checking.
04927  * 
04928  * Sets the field element at index to the string value 
04929  */
04930 void
04931 _MD_set_string (MD_Field * field, int index, char *value)
04932 {

04934 
04935   /* Detect errors, make sure index is not negative! */
04936   if (index < 0)
04937     {
04938       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
04939                "MD_set_string (%s->%s->%s[%d]): Invalid index (%d)\n",
04940                field->entry->section->name, field->entry->name,
04941                field->decl->name, index, index);
04942     }
04943 
04944   /* Detect need to increase max_element_index. */
04945   if (index > field->max_element_index)
04946     {
04947       /* Detect need to increase element array size */
04948       if (index >= field->element_array_size)
04949         {
04950           /* Increase element array size so index can be handled */
04951           MD_resize_element_array (field, index);
04952         }
04953 
04954       /* Set max_element_index to new value */
04955       field->max_element_index = index;
04956     }
04957 
04958   /* Get element */
04959   element = field->element[index];
04960

04966     }
04967   /* Otherwise, free string memory if the existing element is a string */
04968   else if (element->type == MD_STRING)
04969     {

04973   else if (element->type == MD_BLOCK)
