04977     }
04978 
04979   /* Set content of element */
04980   element->field = field;
04981   element->element_index = (unsigned short) index;
04982   element->type = MD_STRING;
04983   element->value.s = MD_strdup (value);
04984 }
04985 
04986 /*
04987  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_string()!
04988  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_string() with
04989  * type checking.
04990  *
04991  * Sets the field element at index to the string value. 
04992  */
04993 void
04994 _MD_set_string_type_checking (MD_Field * field, int index, char *value)
04995 {
04996   /* Call the normal set_string routine first */
04997   _MD_set_string (field, index, value);
04998 
04999   /* Call the check routine for this element */
05000   MD_check_setting (stderr, field, index, "MD_set_string");
05001 }
05002 
05003 /*
05004  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_get_string()!
05005  * This is the function version of the macro MD_get_string().
05006  *
05007  * Gets the string value of the element at the specified index.
05008  * The user must prevent this routine from being called for a NULL element.
05009  * 
05010  * Unlike the macro, this verifies element type is correct.
05011  *
05012  */
05013 char *
05014 _MD_get_string (MD_Field * field, int index)
05015 {
05016   MD_Element *element;
05017 
05018   /* Get the element */
05019   element = field->element[index];
05020 
05021   /* Make sure this is an string element */
05022   if (element->type != MD_STRING)
05023     {
05024       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
05025                "MD_get_string(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n  Accessing %s "
05026                "element as a STRING!",
05027                field->entry->section->name,
05028                field->entry->name, field->decl->name,
05029                index, MD_type_name[(int) element->type]);
05030     }
05031 
05032   /* Return element's value */
05033   return (element->value.s);
05034 }
05035 
05036 /*
05037  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_block()!
05038  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_block() without
05039  * type checking.
05040  * 
05041  * Sets the field element at index to the block value 
05042  */
05043 void
05044 _MD_set_block (MD_Field * field, int index, unsigned int size, void *ptr)
05045 {
05046   MD_Element *element;
05047   void *copied_block;
05048 
05049   /* Detect errors, make sure index is not negative! */
05050   if (index < 0)
05051     {
05052       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
05053                "MD_set_block (%s->%s->%s[%d]): Invalid index (%d)\n",
05054                field->entry->section->name, field->entry->name,
05055                field->decl->name, index, index);
05056     }
05057 
05058   /* Detect need to increase max_element_index. */
05059   if (index > field->max_element_index)
05060     {
05061       /* Detect need to increase element array size */
05062       if (index >= field->element_array_size)
05063         {
05064           /* Increase element array size so index can be handled */
05065           MD_resize_element_array (field, index);
05066         }
05067 
05068       /* Set max_element_index to new value */
05069       field->max_element_index = index;
05070     }
05071 
05072   /* Get element */
05073   element = field->element[index];
05074 
05075   /* Create element if doesn't exist */
05076   if (element == NULL)
05077     {
05078       element = (MD_Element *) L_alloc (MD_Element_pool);
05079       field->element[index] = element;
05080     }
05081   /* Otherwise, free string memory if the existing element is a string */
05082   else if (element->type == MD_STRING)
05083     {
05084       free (element->value.s);
05085     }
05086   /* Otherwise, free block memory if the existing element is a block */
05087   else if (element->type == MD_BLOCK)
05088     {
05089       if (element->value.b.ptr != NULL)
05090         free (element->value.b.ptr);
05091     }
05092 
05093   /* Set content of element */
05094   element->field = field;
05095   element->element_index = (unsigned short) index;
05096   element->type = MD_BLOCK;
05097   element->value.b.size = size;
05098   /* If size is zero, place NULL in ptr */
05099   if (size == 0)
05100     {
05101       element->value.b.ptr = NULL;
05102     }
05103   /* Otherwise, malloc block and memcpy data into it */
05104   else
05105     {
05106       if ((copied_block = (void *) malloc (size)) == NULL)
05107         {
05108           MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
05109                    "_MD_set_block: Out of memory, block size %i.", size);
05110         }
05111       memcpy (copied_block, ptr, size);
05112       element->value.b.ptr = copied_block;
05113     }
05114 }
05115 
05116 /*
05117  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_block()!
05118  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_block() with
05119  * type checking.
05120  *
05121  * Sets the field element at index to the block value. 
05122  */
05123 void
05124 _MD_set_block_type_checking (MD_Field * field, int index,
05125                              unsigned int size, void *ptr)
05126 {
05127   /* Call the normal set_block routine first */
05128   _MD_set_block (field, index, size, ptr);
05129 
05130   /* Call the check routine for this element */
05131   MD_check_setting (stderr, field, index, "MD_set_block");
05132 }

05200 /*
05201  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_link()!
05202  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_link() without
05203  * type checking.
05204  * 
05205  * Sets the field element at index to be a link to the specified entry.
05206  */
05207 void
05208 _MD_set_link (MD_Field * field, int index, MD_Entry * value)
05209 {
05210   MD_Element *element;
05211 
05212   /* Detect errors, make sure index is not negative! */
05213   if (index < 0)
05214     {
05215       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
05216                "MD_set_link (%s->%s->%s[%d]):\n  Invalid index (%d)\n",
05217                field->entry->section->name, field->entry->name,
05218                field->decl->name, index, index);
05219     }
05220 
05221   /* Value may not be a NULL pointer */
05222   if (value == NULL)
05223     {
05224       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
05225                "MD_set_link (%s->%s->%s[%d]):\n  Invalid value (pointer "
05226                "to NULL entry)\n", field->entry->section->name,
05227                field->entry->name, field->decl->name, index);
05228     }
05229 
05230   /* Detect need to increase max_element_index. */
05231   if (index > field->max_element_index)
05232     {
05233       /* Detect need to increase element array size */
05234       if (index >= field->element_array_size)
05235         {
05236           /* Increase element array size so index can be handled */
05237           MD_resize_element_array (field, index);
05238         }
05239 
05240       /* Set max_element_index to new value */
05241       field->max_element_index = index;
05242     }
05243 
05244   /* Get element */
05245   element = field->element[index];
05246 
05247   /* Create element if doesn't exist */
05248   if (element == NULL)
05249     {
05250       element = (MD_Element *) L_alloc (MD_Element_pool);
05251       field->element[index] = element;
05252     }
05253   /* Otherwise, free string memory if the existing element is a string */
05254   else if (element->type == MD_STRING)
05255     {
05256       free (element->value.s);
05257     }
05258   /* Otherwise, free block memory if the existing element is a block */
05259   else if (element->type == MD_BLOCK)
05260     {
05261       if (element->value.b.ptr != NULL)
05262         free (element->value.b.ptr);
05263     }
05264 
05265   /* Set content of element */
05266   element->field = field;
05267   element->element_index = (unsigned short) index;
05268   element->type = MD_LINK;
05269   element->value.l = value;
05270 }
05271 
05272 /*
05273  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_set_link()!
05274  * This is the function version of the macro MD_set_link() with
05275  * type checking.
05276  *
05277  * Sets the field element at index to be a link to the specified entry.
05278  */
05279 void
05280 _MD_set_link_type_checking (MD_Field * field, int index, MD_Entry * value)
05281 {
05282   /* Call the normal set_link routine first */
05283   _MD_set_link (field, index, value);
05284 
05285   /* Call the check routine for this element */
05286   MD_check_setting (stderr, field, index, "MD_set_link");
05287 }
05288 
05289 /*
05290  * DO NOT CALL DIRECTLY!  Use macro MD_get_link()!
05291  * This is the function version of the macro MD_get_link().
05292  *
05293  * Gets the entry pointed to by the link element at the specified index.
05294  * The user must prevent this routine from being called for a NULL element.
05295  * 
05296  * Unlike the macro, this verifies element type is correct.
05297  *
05298  */
05299 MD_Entry *
05300 _MD_get_link (MD_Field * field, int index)
05301 {
05302   MD_Element *element;
05303 
05304   /* Get the element */
05305   element = field->element[index];
05306 
05307   /* Make sure this is an link element */
05308   if (element->type != MD_LINK)
05309     {
05310       MD_punt (field->entry->section->md,
05311                "MD_get_link(%s->%s->%s[%i]):\n"
05312                " Accessing %s element as a LINK!",
05313                field->entry->section->name,
05314                field->entry->name, field->decl->name,
05315                index, MD_type_name[(int) element->type]);
05316     }
05317 
05318   /* Return element's value */
05319   return (element->value.l);
05320 }
05321 
05322 /*
05323  * Deletes the field element at the index specified.
05324  */
05325 void
05326 MD_delete_element (MD_Field * field, int index)
05327 {
05328   MD_Element *element, **element_array;
05329   int max_index;
05330 
05331   /* Get the element array for ease of use */
05332   element_array = field->element;
05333 
05334   /* Get the element we are deleting */
05335   element = element_array[index];
05336 
05337   /* Do nothing if already NULL */
05338   if (element == NULL)
05339     return;
05340 
05341   /* Set the element at the index to NULL in the field's element array */
05342   element_array[index] = NULL;
05343 
05344   /* Free string if element is a string */
05345   if (element->type == MD_STRING)
05346     {
05347       free (element->value.s);
05348     }
05349 
05350   /* Free block memory if element is a block */
05351   else if (element->type == MD_BLOCK)
05352     {
05353       if (element->value.b.ptr != NULL)
05354         free (element->value.b.ptr);
05355     }
05356 
05357   /* Free element */
05358   L_free (MD_Element_pool, element);
05359 
05360   /* Adjust the max_element_index for the field, may need to
05361    * scan over a range of NULL elements.  If field is now
05362    * empty, max_index should be set to -1
05363    */
05364   max_index = field->max_element_index;
05365   while ((max_index > -1) && (element_array[max_index] == NULL))
05366     max_index--;
05367   field->max_element_index = max_index;
05368 }
05369

05371 #if 0

05373 int
05374 main ()
05375 {

05387 
05388

05390

05392   md = MD_new_md ("Test_md", 1);
05393

05395   section = MD_new_section (md, "Test_section", 1, 0);

05397           section->name, section->max_field_index, section->field_array_size);

05411           section->name, section->max_field_index, section->field_array_size,
05412           field_decl2->name, field_decl2->field_index);
05413

05418   MD_require_link (field_decl1, 3, section2);
05419   MD_require_multi_target_link (field_decl1, 4, 2, section_array);
05420   MD_require_double (field_decl1, 5);

05422   MD_require_string (field_decl1, 7);
05423   MD_require_link (field_decl1, 8, section2);

05427   MD_require_int (field_decl1, 11);
05428   MD_require_string (field_decl1, 12);
05429   MD_require_link (field_decl1, 13, section2);
05430   MD_require_multi_target_link (field_decl1, 14, 2, section_array);
05431 
05432   /* Test symbol table routines */
05433   table = section->entry_table;
05434   MD_print_symbol_table_hash (stdout, table);
05435 
05436   for (i = 0; i < 10; i += 3)
05437     {
05438       if (i == 3)
05439         sprintf (buf, "long_name_%i", i);
05440       else
05441         sprintf (buf, "d%i", i);
05442       entry = MD_new_entry (section, buf);
05443 
05444       /* Create some fields in each entry */
05445       field1 = MD_new_field (entry, field_decl1, 0);
05446       MD_set_double (field1, 0, ((double) i) * ((double) 1.001));
05447       MD_set_int (field1, 1, i);
05448       sprintf (buf, "string%i", i);
05449       MD_set_string (field1, 2, buf);
05450       MD_set_link (field1, 4, entry);
05451 
05452       MD_set_double (field1, 5, (double) i);
05453       MD_set_int (field1, 6, i);
05454       sprintf (buf, "string%i", i);
05455       MD_set_string (field1, 7, buf);
05456       MD_set_link (field1, 9, entry);
